through years of teaching ive never met kinder or better guides through my yoga journeyif youve practiced bikram and you love the heat but hate the rigidity come to modoif you want some healing policy that if you show up as class is starting you wont be let in coming in after the teacher has gone in disturbs the quiet calm of the room and it throws the students offthere are also no cell phones in the room and no leaving early yes this is nyc and some studios allow that kind of stuff but at modo they encourage us to have respect for our fellow new yorkers and yogis were all just revisit char sue for a five course dinner menu i immediately said yesthe restaurant is conveniently located just steps away from the delanceyessex stop in the les and is set up for diners and groups of all sizes looking to just grab a quick bite take a seat at the bar or one of the two tops to the side hoping to have a group of friends and family theres a communal table thatll seat everyone at once as well it works for almost any occasion and the food alone is deserving of a special visitdinner began with a new menu addition monkey bread served a top a slice of sweet potato in a thai green curry the bread is a family recipe compliments of chef matty rojas and is soft and pillowy with no small amount of butter perfect for getting that slight crisp at the bottom of the bed its the perfect vehicle for scooping up the spicy and creamy curry and contrasts well with the sweetness of the sweet potato the following dish isnt unfortunately on the permanent menu but if i had my way it would be tender succulent slices of octopus were served with charred brussels sprouts and paired with a spicy pennywort vinaigrette the flavors were reminiscent of the yu xiang 鱼香 sauce that ive grown up eating and was the perfect savoryspicy flavor for the proteinnext up crispy pork belly no other words are really necessary but i did my best to savor each of the three pieces that were served they had a crisp crunchy crust that yielded to a tender and fatty interior and was highlighted even more with the side of a garlicchili dipping sauce it ties with the char sue duck as my favorite dish of the night but how can you compare to a plate of decadent dryaged roast duck coated in a blend of sichuan spices a crisp crackling skin tender and juicy white meat all served a top of bed of warm sushi rice this would easily be my last meal if i ever had to choose one and is more than successful as a modern elevated take on the traditional peking duckto finish a sweet almond pudding with a strawberry jam provided the ideal light finish to the meal and also cemented my desire to camp outside their kitchens for the remainder of my time you think im joking im notim already planning a return visit to char sue and would recommend it to anyone looking for a uniquely nyc restaurant here asian food is redone and reinvented to even better and more delicious forms but still stay true to an extremely tall majestic building now stands at one world trade center wtc scions of american high society have always represented the downtown wealth infrastructure of the manhattan landscape originating from the epitome of wall street which began in the place of the inauguration of our first president george washington at federal hall in it is in the new trending downtown scene stylish and trendy condé nast has become one of the major tenants at one world trade thus making downtown their shiny new headquarters they publish multiple magazines vogue gq vanity fair allure architectural digest ars technica bon appétit brides condé nast traveler details epicurious glamour golf digest golf world gq lucky the new yorker self w and wired condé nast entertainment has successfully progressed in film television and digital video programming industries as wellanna wintour editor in chief at vogue has managed to spread chicness to lower downtown and the people have succumbed to dress more fashionably in the financial district the landscape indeed has changed with this factor plus fallen in step with the fancy digs of brookfield place across the street upscale gentrification has arrivedexpect clusters of bedazzled tourists this is the site of americas worst tragedy we are both amazed and reflective torn but proud the new wtc reflects our tenacity to move forward god bless america

happy memories of summer days and nights at playland i had one of my first teenage kisses in the tunnel of love classic memories for a year old we used to all meet at the recreation center and take the bus id meet a boy from the hood and ride home in his car i kept my curfew though i was just spending summers i wanted to be allowed to return each year theres a beach i cant remember swimming there i enjoyed the rides the dragon coaster and fun house especially we always found lots of junk food to eat it was a highlight of the summer i couldnt wait to return i even have photos of my mother at playland before she got married its great to pass memories of a historic amusement park down to future generations my daughter always went when she visited connecticut in summer if you get a chance visit this piece of history or you might watch the movie big with tom hanks youll see scenes shot there towards the end of the movie if i remember correctly

been a seismic shift in the chinese culinary scene in manhattan for years ive had to make a tough choice between pleasing my taste buds or my eyes when coworkers asked for recommendations i struggled to think of a single name that would score high on all three metricsauthenticity decor and service alas we cannot have it all or so i thought enter megawealthy chinese restaurateurs and investors loaded with cash money this wealth is not only flooding the investments market but also penetrating the culinary scene several new restaurants backed by big names are slated to open in and these are imports straight from the motherland so are guaranteed to be good finally new yorkers will discover what chinese food is actually like in china all rejoice lets take a moment to think about how fat were gonna get ok good now sichuan mountain house has already generated a significant following in flushing it made its debut in saint marks place last week and i just had to see it myself the chinese name which has much more character references a rather curious nocturnal animal with poor vision but a great sense of smell i can imagine all the dinners turning into pangolins as soon as they enter tuning into the deliciously spicy aroma of chili peppers the owners want to create an atmosphere that is just like a little house in the szechuan province boy did they do a good job the interior transports me into an episode of wu lin wai zhuan the service is impeccable as for the food i dont see a need to elaborate other than subtly suggesting that your entire outlook on life will be improved out of the or so dishes we tried these especially stood out sliced pork belly with chili garlic soy their signature dish literal translation white meat draped over a clothing line steamed crab with sticky rice the sticky rice was perfectly cooked and having soaked in all the flavors of the crab meat simply delicious i could eat three bowls of this fish fillet with pickled mustard green the broth was reduced to a white creamy consistency that is making me salivate as im thinking about it now the mushrooms were very fresh fried rice with pineapple i usually try to stay as far away from fried rice as possible but this dish cast fried rice in a whole new light the pineapples were slightly tart and sweet lighting up the rice and seafood a note on the tea the complimentary tea is seriously good its not that moldy threeday old stuff restaurants forget to refresh given the aroma i suspect it is tie guan yin its cleansing and a perfect foil for all the spicy dishes thumbs up on choice of teai expect sichuan mountain house to go far and it will be more than deserving of whatever status it achieves a shortlist of new restaurants slated for manhattan openings dadong the original beijing roast duck they announced a november opening and was immediately booked straight through december holy bananas dalongyi sichuanstyle hotpot dou lao fang the dolar shop cantonese style according to wikipedia pangolins have large protective keratin scales covering their skin and they are the only known mammals with this feature they live in hollow trees or burrows depending on the species pangolins are nocturnal and their diet consists of mainly ants and termites which they capture using their long tongues they tend to be solitary animals meeting only to mate and produce a litter of one to three offspring which are raised for about two years pangolins are threatened by hunting for their meat and scales and heavy deforestation of their natural habitats and are the most trafficked mammals in the world so no eating pangolins you animals

noodle cravingsrevisitedso after a year of missing this place i was sitting in my house and im like you know what im gonna get noodles tonight this place popped in my head so i hopped on the train and arrived here as i walked in i could already smell the flaring heat and the spicy smells of the noodle babymaking going on in the kitchen i realized why i needed to come back herespicy spicy i ordered the beef with layman noodles and i told them to make it the spiciest you can possibly make it eating into the noodles was a rush of the spicy goodness mixed with the juice bell peppers and chopped tomatoes it was filled with pure joy as i took each bite they also have water right next to the kitchenits just right for the meal they also have dumplings you can not forget about dumplings what are your thoughtsi truly love this place i will come back here with friends my family cause this place is a hidden gem in harlem so if you happen to be strolling along and in need of a early afternoon or late night noodle pull then this place will be for you

i had been eyeing pizzaniste since before they opened while one may think this is yet another pizzeria being added to the tremont ave strip the floortoceiling windows which made up the exterior led me to think this was something different today i had the opportunity to grab lunch here with my brother and found that my suspicions were accurate unlike most pizzerias at pizzaniste you can choose from a number of individual sized pie creations or you can create your own pizza with custom toppings i was a fan of the aesthetics the front walls of the restaurant are able to fully extend out and as such pizzaniste has a very open feel to it its larger than most pizzerias and has a modern decor with lots of clean lines and a full view of the workstation where you can see your pie being assembledwhile you can create your own pie they have a number of them on the menu that you can choose from as well i decided to take the latter option and went with the spinach artichoke pizza this was a white pizza topped with guess what artichokes spinach and ricotta i was a fan the pies are made to order so it was super fresh the flavors worked really well together service was amazing everyone was super friendly and eager to help from the time we walked in we were greeted warmly and it continued up until we left aside from the food its things like this that set a business apart from others and i need to commend them for a job well doneoverall pizzaniste is a great place its not your typical pizzeria but its a welcome and arguably needed change in this area of the bronx which is oversaturated with pizza places the fresh ingredients they use and killer service they provide definitely make them a for me great job guys

hip urban inspirational art walk elevated warm sunshine kisses your face as you stroll along the highline a faint breeze greets you as you notice the unique ever changing art its clear that the group who preserved this piece of history really are friends of the highline inspired by mother nature and made with love in nyc all around great experience for just about everyonebefore its construction in trains which came directly into what the industrial district had more than a handful of collisions which led to the construction of elevated train tracks as an initiative to improve safety the tracks provided a safer way to bring food and agriculture efficiently into lower manhattan as transportation methods changed the highline became unused in the left unattended for years nature had her own design and when demolition crews were eyeing the structure friends of the highline was formed to preserve what we now see today with over annual public programs it truly is one of nycs little gems complete with sitting areas dining sculptures changing artwork and a picture window where you can watch all of the cars zoom by make sure your phone is fully charged youll want to snap pictures along the mile walkthe scene hip romantic family friendlydestination rating rating nob potential suggestion if you have kids who are train fanatics the end of the highline should not be missed street overlooks the train yard for penn station and has a violin installation which has audio that accompanies the trains which are coming and going commute hours have the most trains pack a snack and sit down and watch beautiful sunset views as well

in the world of doughnuts theres either amazing doughnuts or crappy doughnuts and dunwell is amazing i had the blueberry peanut yeast doughnut and was curious at first about the flavor combo but was surprised at how well they worked together the doughnut itself wasnt too doughy or heavy and not greasy the flavor was definitely there with the icing not being overly sweet freshness is definitely something these guys pay attention to it seems with about to different flavors theres not hundred donuts laying around all day small batches guarantee freshness with any place friendly staff decent prices clean shopid definitely go backbonus theyre vegan

of all the japanese chains opening in nyc lately i was most excited to hear about ikinari steaks first us location i expected a line to be out the door on opening day but was very surprised there wasnt one when i arrived around am they opened at it was mostly press standing around blocking waitresses that were trying to bring food to customers or pressing against diners trying to eat there were only few actual diners but more customers started to stroll in by the time i left i was shown to a standing station right away and was done in min without scarfing down my food the menu is small with cuts of wetaged steak by weight and lunch special a few sides and a few drinks including beer and wine current prices are centsgram for ribeye centsgram for sirloin centsgram for filet there are minimum weight orders for the steaks so ribeye starts at sirloin at and filet at it works instead of going to a counter to order first an employee will showdirect you to a numbered standing station their model is based on standing dining stations but this location has a small number of seats ask about seats if you prefer one menus are already at the standing station a waiter will come over to bring water a paper apron take your order for drinks and sides only then the waiter will walk you or direct you to the back kitchen counter to order your meat cut of meat and weight you showtell the kitchen chef your table numbereven if you order the chuckeye steak lunch special which is not available by weight you still have to go tell the kitchen counter your order a little odd but i guess this is to make the process consistent for the staff after you order your steak you go back to your station and your food is brought out to you forks knives napkins condiments are already at your station there were no spoons a bill is brought to you when your steak is delivered keep it so you can pay at the front desk when you leavei had the chuckeye steak lunch special because its a good deal it comes with soup salad white rice media reports say the chuckeye is oz the lunch menu lists or oz the soup and salad are very small and basic but youre really paying for the steak my steak came out sliced on a sizzling platter with a side of corn the chuckeye already had nice color on the outside but was blue rare on the inside theres even a printed guide on how to enjoy your steak and they suggest rarei usually prefer my steak medium or medium rare but i went rare this time my chuckeye was very tender and flavorful from the fat and seasoning the house hot steak sauce was delicious but didnt cover up the steak not sure if the house steak sauce is hot because its warm and kept in a thermos or also spicy if there is spice i didnt really taste it but having warm sauce is perfect to help keep the steak warm theres also ikinari sauce that is a sweet sauce its also tasty but i preferred the house steak sauce they also sell bottles of the ikinari saucethey are a nontipping restaurant i walked out full and happy from chuckeye steak lunch for after taxabout that paper apronits a good idea to help keep any grease splatter from the sizzling hot plate from getting on your clothes the standing stations have lots of storage a shelf where you can place menus after ordering or to store items a hook to hang a coat or bags and even foldable stands on the floor that can hold briefcases or bags the kitchen is open so you do walk out smelling smokey like hibachi or kbbq places the restroom has a fancy japanese toilet with a dryer option theres also listerine if you want to be minty fresh and if youre so inclined they have a niku mileage membership card that you can sign up for to track the weight of meat you eat the card comes complete with lady liberty and has rewards after consuming a certain amount of beef ill be back to try other cuts definitely recommend trying this place for quality steak at reasonable prices

for those looking for the quintessential parisian bistro experience look no further than one of the latest newcomers to manhattans west village boucherie the restaurant opened at the end of to no small amount of acclaim thanks to the fact that chef jerom dihui former chef of mcnallys now shuttered pastis is behind the kitchens the venue has a sprawling dining room and bar area that gets plenty of sunlight during the earlier hours as well as a balcony on the second floor for those looking to impress everything about the decor from the sizeable mirror hung behind the bar to the marblepatterned tables and tiled floors is true to formon a breezy saturday evening the restaurant was happily buzzing and unsurprisingly occupied reservations in advance especially on busy days are recommended we had our pick of seats i recommend taking a table near the windowed doors or on the patio and were soon greeted by our server and paul the sommelier when i asked him for a wine recommendation a white or sparkling not too dry he pointed out an effervescent and slightly sweet brut rose which he asked me to taste first to make sure it was to my liking pinning down choices from the food menu however wasnt quite as easy so we ending up ordering almost all the dishes that had caught our eyesfor our starters we had gone with the escargot and the foie gras mousse the former were served piping hot and generously drenched in an addictive garlic butter and parsley sauce they were pleasantly toothsome and had none of the aftertaste ive sometimes encountered in dishes that werent executed to par ask for an extra side of bread to soak up the remaining sauce its that good my personal favorite however had to be the foie gras mousse its beautifully presented with a side of red wine onion compote frisee and toasted bread there are few things more perfectly balanced than a spread of the rich foie gras against the sweettartness of the onion compote supported by the firm slightly crunchy bread it may appear to be simple but theres a reason why this dish has stood the test of timewhen it came to the entrees i immediately gravitated to towards the duck confit which is served with a portion of confited duck leg frisee salad and a generous serving of black truffle chips the duck had a delightful crisp skin that yielded to a flavorful dark meat which paired well with the lighter salad that had the protein interspersed throughout it i was able to try the veal porterhouse as well which came impressively presented with the bone still in it was cooked to the requested medium rare and each portion of meat was juicy and tender pairing well with the red wineinfused veal jus that it was served with we rounded out our meal with a side of fries crispy hot and perfectly seasoned as well as a rustic ratatouille made with roasted tomatoes zucchini onions and mushroomswhat makes boucherie excel however is the caliber of service our plates were always promptly cleared and our server was always nearby to check on us when i dropped my knife off the table she was immediately at my side with a new one and while i may not be a wine expert those who do appreciate it will easily get lost in conversation with their sommelier paul he took a great deal of time to speak with us about his previous experiences including le bernardin and answered every question we had from the wines available at boucherie to the levels of certification as indicated by his sommerlier pini very much look forward to returning now that the weather will allow for dining al fresco and for those looking for a leisurely and welcoming meal in the city boucherie will certainly exceed your expectations

my friend recommended unfade to me as she got her hair colored by roy roy being the boss man had limited availability and also a higher price tag so i took a look at yelp to see which other stylists i could consider leo got great reviews and i was impressed by his work on his instagram so i decided on him i wanted to turn my mostly virgin asian black hair into a rooty dusty pink cloud leo was fantastic we had a half hour long consult and he explained very thoroughly what i could or could not expect and what my options wereleo was definitely very knowledgeable about color theory and has a great eye for colors that work together i enjoyed how articulate he was about the technical aspect of hair coloring it made communication a breeze since i enjoyed being equally technical he recommended blending my hair with a purple into the dusty pink and the end result is even better than i expected the whole thing about rounds of bleaching i cant remember and a color melt set me back about well worth the hours he put in and the beautiful result

ive recently been on a mexican crave and was so happy to find a brand new choza that just opened inside the gotham west market i got the tacos with chicken carnitas pork and steak corn elote on the sidethe tacos arent huge in fact theyre very cute size about inches across but theyre packed with flavor and the meats are very well braised and marinated like most soft shell places the tortillas are double layered which i find a bit unnecessary i just eat one layer but the key is in the mix of meats cheeses salsas and toppings perfect balance and blend of spices what really stood out was actually the corn most taco joints dont have corn on the cob and the mix of sprinkled cheese and sauce on sweet corn made it high addicting and uniqueglad to have a taco joint near my apartment

vanilla ice cream could have fed people easily but i would go for this in a heartbeat again it was a truly sweet end to our meal overall a really pleasant experience at the clocktower and a successful cafe bari has saved my ass too many times i work in soho which is very very far from where i live though i tend to make coffee at home before work i will occasionally need a second or third or fourth cup due to the nature of my job some use nicotine as a stimulant some use caffeine i happen to like my lungs clear and healthy so i choose the latter cafe bari along with being comically convenient has fabulous coffee served by fabulous folks in fabulously fast time cant ask for much more than that in a neighborhood coffeeshop convenient you ask cafe bari is both subwayconvenient and officeconvenient in my very specific case you can pretty much step right off the subway platform at canal street and right into cafe bari i also happen to work on east broadway which is a wasteland when it comes to togo options bari is just steps from my office so roundtrip plus orderingwaiting is about five minutes theres a starbucks equidistant from my office but i virtually never go there now that ive discovered bariim from philly hold the boos please so i grew up being taken to la colombe in manayunk my parents are big coffeedrinkers as well so i started young my coffee knowledge is slightly above remedial but i can at least tell the difference between dunkin donuts starbucks coffee bean or what used to be coffee bean and a more artisan place like bari namely that bari is head and shoulders like shaqs head and shoulders any of that chain crap when i heard that bari served la colombe coffee i ran over there within the hour even better than i remembered probably because im a working adult now and not a teenager wanting to get into coffee because my parents made it seem cool i told you this couldve just as easily been cigarettes and thank god its not bari has your standard offerings as far as cafes go like a lot of these hipster places they only have two sizes the large is about the size of a starbucks grande if you need a reference point my goto drink there is a large almond milk cappucino which is if youre worried about quantity i suppose you should go corporate but i promise you that quality over quantity is a particularly salient argument in this case theyve got that awesome almond milk there thats specifically made for coffee which makes a huge difference add in one of those lovely steamed milk hearts atop each drink and now youve got coffee and a smile ah yes a smile a genuine smile not a routine getoutofmyfacesoicangettothenextcustomerandimreallyexasperated kind of smile the staffbaristas at cafe bari are fabulous everyones nice everyones friendly and theyve got awesome taste in music today i walked in and they were blasting britney then nsync then spice girls a magical tbt service is fast product is topnotch though i cant speak to the abundance of pastries here i can report that my coworker comes in with a chocolate croissant from cafe bari every morning and devours it so i can directly say theyre delicious i suppose pretty sure everything that comes out of this smallbutmighty shop is a slam dunk

villages loss is my gain because as soon as we stepped outside after our meal we made plans to come back the following weekend to try more dishes when we first came in at around right when it opened i had a brief moment of panic that this place wouldnt survive the lack of foot traffic around this second avenueadjacent neck of the woods then the place filled up to capacity within minutes so back making all the food the waitress manning the former sushi counter was very sweet and explained each dish as she brought it out but she didnt know things like byob or leaving a partys name down i ate alot of spaghetti in collegei think the only things i could cook were mashed potatoes scrambled eggs boil spaghetti and make cereal it was a bachelor nightmaremaybe thats why my mind went a little blank at my plate of wonderful spaghetti at spaghetti incident the room was handsome dimly lit with a brick wall mirrors with cute planters underneath it felt like a little italian home miles away from the lower east side poser scenean adroit young man with a new bass voice who couldnt have been had the grace and poise of the best waiter i ever had he checked on me just enough was warm with enough distance and quickly recommended his favorite dishes with descriptions and without hesitation the kitchen is open and i could smell my spaghetti with salsciccia cooking with garlic pork and white wine the pasta is house made and al dente a treasure confirmed by the happy italians dining next to meglasses for montepulciano were a breezy and generous i opted for a second glass over the panna cotta a not so easy decision but the place is cash only so i wanted to have enough to leave a generous tipthis cozy bistro is a little gem if you love spaghetti and if you dont you should come for the small plates and desserts and drink wine which ill do in the very near future atmosphere cozy and wonderfulfood clean fresh simple and homemade
as a skeptic of any cha siu place that isnt a hole in the wall i was blown away by the deliciousness quality of the food here in addition to the atmosphere cleanliness and friendliness of the waiters crispy roast duck in the mantou sandwich was super flavorful and i highly recommend it i was expecting a small mantou with a little bit of duck for a pricey but boy i was wrong huge mantou with a bit of that duck fat grease and enough pieces of duck that youd see on an entree prepare for this to be messy to eat naturally just pick up the duck pieces that fall out with your fork and add some of their heavenly chili sauce to it the five spice short rib plate with egg noodles was surprisingly tasty as well short rib is fall off the bone except they make it even easier and take out the bones already topped with a bunch of garlicky saucy garnishes including braised daikon it was super delicious my only feedback is that the egg noodles were a tad soggy and a tiny bit bland though that might have been bc i didnt mix some parts of it well as everything else was bursting with flavor but this was entirely made up for when sprinkling some of their garlic chili flakes and oil admittedly an entire mantou sandwich and egg noodles plate was too much for one person but im glad i tried both and was pleasantly surprised at the big portion sizes ill be back again for that crispy roast duck

ribsthe steamed pork buns were excellent the buns were pillowy soft but just firm enough to hold up to tender braised pork and boy was the kitchen generous with the pork the accompanying pickled cucumbers provided a nice acidity and textural contrast this was served with ssam sauce which tasted like a lighter gochujang sauce korean chili paste honestly the pork buns are pretty much perfect as is i think adding the ssam sauce is a disservice the fried brussels sprouts were yummmmmy the fish sauce was not overpowering as it was balanced by an herb mixture that made it more of an assertive vinaigrette to coat the perfectly fried brussels sprouts the duck in the duck dumplings was just ok i couldnt really discern the taste of the duck itself but i thought the crispy wanton with a sea salt crust and the mint sauce were excellent the seared pork ribs were succulent they were marinated in gochu sauce and then seared somehow i thought the glaze on top was more teriyaki then gochu but i loved the smokey umami flavor as well as the toasted sesame seeds and the spice from the scallions it was quite tender and fell off the bone that we could eat the ribs with silverwarehowever i think this dish is improperly labeled under ssam ssam means lettuce wrap in korean so i thought the ribs would be accompanied by lettuce or some kind of veggies but the dish was just five giant pieces of ribs our waitress was gracious enough to bring over some lettuce when i asked but i dont think it makes sense for the main entree to be just hunks of meat without any veggies regardless i saw that the grilled porgy comes with tortillas for you to make fish tacos with at the table so i think the label is appropriate depending on what you order but dont expect all of the ssam courses to come out in the lettuce wrap style like you would for the familystyle option we finished the meal with the creme brulee which is highly recommended the custard is matcha infused with thai basil the perfume of that and the brulee on top are heavenly my god i can have this all to myself and i would still want more i cant wait to come back to try their seafood donabe as the table next to me ordered it and it looked delectable with so much seafood id order all of the above dishes again in a heartbeat except for the duck dumplings
nothing man produces in my opinion could ever surpass the beauty found in nature but in some instances mans genius comes close coming on the heels of the spectacular orchid exhibit here is another stunner the dale chihuly exhibit this artist has managed with hand blown colored glass to mold creations that evoke images of flamingoes stars sea anemones and other fantastical forms some are huge impressive structures as tall as trees with squiggly swirly extensions that fascinate and capture the eye others resemble ordinary objects like balls only dazzling in their color combinations all are intriguing this is a stellar exhibit that i recommend seeing in various lights on a cloudy day during a sunny day and during extended evening hours when they are lit up even if you see it only once the exhibit will impress and of course the gardens themselves are always magnificent any timenote the dale chihuly exhibit is on until october if you go now you get the lovely cherry and lilac trees in bloom to enjoy while you stroll through the rest of the parkextra treat at the gardens birders should know that there is a pair of nesting great horned owls at the gardens now you wont be able to photograph them without a tripod and a long long telephoto bring your binoculars unless you care to stare at the façade of a building to seenothing

photorealisma genre of artencompassing extremely realistic painting drawing and other graphic mediain which the artwork is based entirely on a photographafter reading fellow yelper helens review i couldnt resist i took a mental note that i had to put this on my list of things to do after a very early morning great experience at the metropolitan museum of art i made my way over to the bernarducci meisel gallery i entered the gallery and stood and pondered in front of many of the arts on display mesmerized and amazed by the artistry upon first glance your eyes immediately see a photograph and then as you step closer the realization dawns on you that they are actually either a painting or drawingunbelievable for a long moment i stood and imagined myself seated with a glass of champagne continuing to listen to the mellow smooth jazz playing in the background and staring at these pieces thats how much i wanted to stay and immerse myself further a thank you goes to kimberly who kindly answered all of my many questions and also allowing me to catch a glimpse of their resident puppy while venturing farther throughout the gallery the arts of raphaella spence and emily copeland who i have now deemed among my favorites are on display with ester curini and others this current exhibit will end april and is a must see for those who can appreciate the arts current exhibit pricing and upupcoming exhibit size doesnt matter plus artists to participate april located on floor

worth the wait and definitely not just a gimmick of standing while you eat one of the best and cheapest steaks ive had i was surprised to see such a long line but it moved very quickly there was about people in front of me but i was able to get seated in an hour the smell when you walk in is heavenly the system works like a welloiled machine you would think that a bunch of diners standing around would make things chaotic but the staff who are some of the friendliest ive encountered in nyc swiftly took our drink and side orders before directing us to the cut to order station to pick out our steaks tip if dining for just two i highly recommend asking for the total grams of steak ie and then having it cut in half that way you get a thicker cut of steak which will be much juicier and tastier vs asking for two separate cuts there are plenty of helpful signs and staff around to help out if youre unsure of which type ribeye filet or sirloin or weight to get there are also ounce conversions the was plenty for me and i went with the ribeye and yes you should get rare or at worst medium rare anything further is just downright disrespectfulthe food came out pretty quickly about minutes on sizzling plates it was divine the steaks come with corn topping but you can replace with a variety of other veggies or add extras for each i highly recommend the ikinari sauce on your steak it doesnt take away from the flavor but rather enhances it the quality and taste of the meat was so good and an amazing value considering the price do not pass on the garlic rice one of the most delicious side dishes ever mixed with more corn crispy garlic bits of steak and pepper a divine combination the standing while eating concept was a great experience i didnt mind it at all it was fun casual and made people eat a power dinner which must have contributed to the line moving quickly a huge kudos again to the amazing staff who were so attentive even though ikinari is marked as a nontipping establishment i will definitely be back

i love love love this place when dinosaur visited la he wasnt a fan of the city but he was a big fan of kazunori kazunori is the sister restaurant of sugarfish located on street kazunori specializes in handrollsthe interior is modern and chic good ambiance for casual date nights or even a quick lunch break by yourself selfseated establishment grab a menu and an open seat quick turnover so dont be discouraged by the line the concept is simple fish on rice wrapped in crispy nori what sets kazunori apart from other restaurants is their nori the nori is unreal and i wish i knew the secret from keeping them so dry and crispy he got the roll combo salmon lobster crab bay scallop yellow tail toro roll combo for me super filling dont underestimate these hand rolls my fav are the bay scallop and crab service is on point they make the hand rolls in front of you and place them on your serving paper tip eat them as soon as they are made before the nori gets soggy cant get enough of these simple but amazing hand rollswelcome to nyc kazunori

what else can be said about st pattis that hasnt been said before recently renovated st patricks really is an amazing building nice tall pillars inside beautiful glass windowsafter its renovation it looks brand new something that was way over due for this amazing building which sits in the mist of this busy city because of its location it attracts a lot of tourist of course but both locals tourists can enjoy this beautiful church just like many other places of worship masses are held here on a daily basis along with plenty of special occasion as we have all seem my most recent visit brought me here for mass on ash wednesday lovely service being a new yorker sometimes we can easily forget that we have beautiful places like this in our backyard tend to end up not paying any attention to it local or tourist this amazing church is definitely worth the visit
anyone who lives in the bronx knows its a bitch to get from the east side to the west side of the borough and vice versa no train lines run eastwest and there are few roads that connect as well however i was in the mood for sushi tonight and yelp searching sushi bronx brought aoyu up as the top result it had a high review average and reviews so i decided to make the trek to riverdale and try it aoyu is small and narrow like most other sushi bars ive been to the color scheme is mostly white with splashes of dark woods and black a very clean look which makes the dining room look very open the seats were nice and comfortable even the chopsticks had a finished look to them almost metallic not the normal wooden ones as soon as we were seated a server brought us hot towels to wash our hands a really nice surprise the menu has a selection of rolls ramen and other dishes we started with garlic broccoli basically just steamed broccoli tossed with garlic it was so simple yet so tasty full of flavor for my main i chose two rolls they have a classic roll section of the menu as well as a specialty roll section i went with a king crab california roll from the regular roll selection and the american dream roll from the specialty roll selection ooh the american dream had shrimp tempura and spicy tuna in it covered with a sauce which made it super tasty both rolls were fresh and delicious service was very good everyone was friendly and attentive i was very impressed with aoyu ill definitely be back

this was my first broadway musical ever setting the bar quite high am i righti acquired tickets through an amex presale back in june and saw the show beginning of february facevalue seats in the back of the orchestra center section ended up being about apiece currently the lowest price you can find on thirdparty sites is about per ticket and thats for the back of the mezzanine seating curse you thirdparty sites and high demand the hamilton show lottery currently releases seats for each max tickets per person but as tens of thousands people enter this lottery the tickets are hard to come by hopefully soon demand goes down and therefore prices will go down too who knows though nonetheless just keep scouring the internet and do what you can to get a ticket at a relatively reasonable price it might be physically and emotionally draining but just save your strength and stay aliverichard rodgers theater perhaps not the best possible venue but the good thing is that there really dont seem to be any terrible seats and the capacity aint half bad as previously mentioned we were seated in the very back of the orchestra center section and we had a pretty great view of the stage on the other hand the seats themselves were a little cramped and the crowds can get a little out of hand preshow and during the intermission nonetheless given how good hamilton is you will more than willingly brave these conditions for this particular showhamilton the musical lives up to the massive hype and is certainly not at all overrated as one orangetoned man may have previously declared i hadnt listened to any of the songs or read any wikipedia articles so as to go into the show with a relatively unadulterated view anyways i was worried that some of the rap dialogue might be hard to follow but it turned out to be fine since all the actors and actresses enunciate exceptionally well and the singing and stage directing was obviously top notch javier muñoz brandon victor dixon lexi lawson and mandy gonzalez were all great in their respective roles of hamilton burr and the schuyler sisters and taran killam was super funny as king george after the show i bought the original broadway cast soundtrack and have yet to stop listening to it during the show i for some reason felt super proud being the son of immigrants who worked their tails off to make it in america and the show does a good job not only telling the story of alexander hamilton but honoring those who sacrifice all to be part of the american narrative not only that there are some bomba rap battles air horn soundsanxiously waiting for them to release a live video recording of the show or waiting to see if i can somehow get tickets again if you havent seen it you definitely need to but you didnt need me to tell you that you want to be in the room where it happens

visit was for my birthday party last year i was taking a bit of a gamble on this one a venue i have been only once though i was so glad i did it was perhaps one of the best venues i hosted a birthday no hassle whatsoever and with drinks and food a flowing i can say if they can cater so well to a large party regular service must only equate or exceedi was looking for a classy cocktail bar venue that accomodated at least people throughout a friday evening with a fair priced menu of food and drink not easy to find in the city at all without a large price tag to come along with it with a bit of handy internet research though hill dale proved the best option and suspicious at first hours open bar of beer and wine for person plus an entire room reserved only for us without an extra charge a minimum number of guests was the only main requirement a bright colored wristband was distributed to each of my guests who participated in the bar special so it was easy to spot we sat and stood around a nicely adorned space of exposed brick by a non functioning fireplace conveniently adjacent to the bar so ordering drinks was never an issue the beer menu included craft and was not limited to your typical sam adams or bud lite there was a choice of different wines the food menu was their regular menu of bar fare couches and sofas were in our comfortably cozy area so seating was never an issue a waitress came by several times to ask if we needed food and cleaned our tables throughout the two hours tater tots anyone cant beat a bar that serves tater tots food was delicious aside all things music was great and not an obnoxious playlist of your typical mainstream pop songs not bad at all hill dale not bad at all in fact it was all so much better than i was expectingi was completely astonished by the great service and hospitality provided that friday evening for such a large group of people but not limited to just us the bar was bustling with customers as the night went on but things were running very smoothly for myself and my guests my friends were asking how i found this place a few friends left more than just a little happy for this amazing birthday experience hill dale remains somewhere on top of the list i speak highly of their service for a large birthday party with that in mind i feel strongly that normal service can only go the same way last note beer and wine is an option always but definitely try the cocktails hill dale is built on a reputation of some delicious mixed drinks of quality ingredients all in all i find little to no reason to complain about this place and hopefully all types of occasions will be as wonderful as i had experienced

shop but i think thats the charm its to recreate in these tiny conditions the comforts of a malaysian coffee shop kopi tiam or a house while giving the customer extensive transparency in seeing how the food is preparedthe food is cheap nothing on the menu goes near the mark a good portion of it is devoted to pastries kuih but there are also minimeals such as nasi lemak coconut rice with anchovies and a boiled egg for or the chilled spicy noodles i have had the pleasure after seeing this place open near me to visit a couple of times after eating nasi lemak at least three times i decided to try the spicy noodlesi enjoyed both a lot the nasi lemak comes with a generous dollop of coconut rice the coconut flavor is not that strong most of the flavor eventually comes from the anchovies and the sambal spicy sauce condiments such as cucumber give a refreshing taste especially after eating the sambal im not malaysian so i might be unorthodox for doing this i usually mix the rice with the sambal and the anchovies counter to my usual ocd ways the spicy noodles are served at room temperature with cucumber and a boiled egg i asked the owner to swap the egg for cucumber the cucumber again gives a cool and refreshing taste and the soup came to surprise one would hardly associate something served room temperature with something spicy it was an interesting combination that i think they pulled off wellat my most recent visit i had the opportunity to learn more about the owner when she gave her story shes very nice and is a very sociable person her parents owned a restaurant in malaysia and she compared the experiences of her owning her own place she described how she imported the bowls were imported from malaysia the owners chatty and relaxed vibe matches what would be expected from a coffee house or someones house a slower pace a break from the hustle and bustle of the city some place to really warm up and talk to someone all while sipping on quality coffee and eating some of the dishes for cheapi find it near impossible to criticize any aspect of the place perhaps one might say that i was too generous with my rating but i stand by with what i said

warning to all that love to crunch on nuts i had no idea that almonds are one of the hardest nuts to chew i know now i cant remember the last time i had a cavity i floss and brush after each meal im a fanatic well i still lost a tooth from crunching hard almonds and other nuts for the past few years eating lunch i felt a crack in my molar split that tooth in half down the middle no pain but very uncomfortable to eat you never let a cracked tooth go or bacteria gets in very serious the next day i went to the dentist to see if my tooth could be saved the answer was no their in home oral surgeon was not available for a week and a half knowing how sick ive been recently i asked if they could recommend someone i might be able to see sooner they referred me to doctor tuchman and even made the appointment he saw me the next morning at unheard of typically for me by the time i arrived home from the dentist i had an email confirming my appointment and instructions to complete the patient medical questionaire on line i did so with ease and was amazed at the high tech process excellent i immediately received a conformation from the office the young lady i had spoken to on the phone earlier handled everything for doctor tuchman also included in the email were the detailed instructions pre oral surgery and my options for anesthesia plus steps for post surgery care of the extraction site next morning i arrived at the office very comfortable and clean i didnt even have the opportunity to sit and the young lady i had been communicating with came over introduced herself and handled my introduction to the dental assistant very nice assistant took me to my chair and explained a few things prepping me for surgery in a couple minutes doctor tuchman arrived he took his time explaining in detail all of my options and very patiently answering my questions i naturally selected local anesthetic no ones putting me to sleep at my age i failed to tell him im very susceptible to drugs he over did it with three shots i was numb for seven hours or more i must say either im nerve dead or he is super good at extractions i did not have any pain after the jaw was a little swollen i used ice packs which they provide and they provided gause for bleeding i turned down prescription for pain reliever i get very sick from those i may have taken a couple tylenol as i said i never had any pain the following day doctor tuchman called and we also emailed back and forth with any questions or concerns i had the extraction was on a wednesday on friday he contacted me by phone one last time to see how i was doing he reassured me i could email if needed him over the weekend or the following week i received wonderful caring treatment throughout the whole process i would highly recommend doctor tuchman i know if im still living in manhattan and need oral surgery i will go to doctor tuchman since i dont have dental insurance it set me back a couple months of my monthly budget allowance manhattan prices are a killer if you want the best care bring a fat wallet or excellent creditjust remember avoid hard nuts when i did some research on line theres been a recent epidemic of broken and split teeth from almonds dont let this happen to you

sashimi we opted for the piece sashimi omakase pp they give you a couple of appetizers which were all pretty good there was a soup and ice cream mochi for dessert in this set the sashimi that came with this course were really good fish was fresh of course wouldnt have expected anything less if im paying pp i thought the sashimi was very little for the price i think the piece sushi with no sashimi was so for an extra i only had like pieces of fish different kinds tuna clam and red snapper nonetheless it was really good no regrets the red snapper was my favorite of them all although i dont remember a lot of the fishes i tried i really enjoyed the hokkaido uni compared with the santa barbara uni he was nice enough to let me try the hokkaido onewow probably the best uni ive ever had to be honest i really enjoyed this place because they gave such a huge variety of different fish selections so i never got bored ive been to some omakase places in ny where they do not give as many different selections they will use the same types of fishes and just serve it a different way this restaurant is very small very intimate i also liked that they had a small cup with a wet towel for people who wanted to eat the sushi with their hands instead of chopsticks that was something small but new to me the fish was so good and fresh that eating it with soy sauce would be completely wrong you just put each whole piece in your mouth as is no soy sauce not like the american way of eating sushi dont come here expecting dragon rolls or california rolls this is the real sushisashimi stuff if you want dragons rolls and all that stick to your japanese restaurants owned by chinese people lol great experience here i would def come back some day expensive but great quality fish

i was super impressed with eatsa i was excited to try it but since its their first few days open in this location i had expected there might be a few issues but there werent so the basic concept is that you go in and order from an ipad or you can order from their app and once its ready you go pick it up from a little cubby its also relatively healthy with all the bowls being either quinoa or salad based and there doesnt appear to be any meat on the menu fyi and pretty inexpensive i had downloaded the app and previewed the menu and options but i actually wanted to go in and see what it was like the only human interaction with people working there was them guiding you to the ipad and asking you to move over while you wait you dont even really need any help since its so simple you can choose a bowl and then customize it to your liking or just customize a bowl from scratch i went with the smoke house salad and was able to take out the things i didnt want and add in the things i did super easy and i really dont even think i had to wait minutes for it to be ready there was a small crowd of people nothing really too crazy but all the food seemed to come out really fast there was a small area high counter for eating but i took it back to my office to eat everything in it seemed really fresh and it was so good im happy this opened down the block from my office hopefully it wont get too crazy when more people discover it but ill definitely be back

one of the few places i ever expected to find myself at was le bernardin why well as a child growing up i abhorred seafood and fish of any kind it was partially derived from being exposed to a limited number of dishes but mostly due to my stubborn nature but i digress but for those looking to truly find some of the best seafood in new york city le bernardin should be at the top of the list the accolades are numerous including a consistent string of michelin stars four nyt stars and a nearperfect zagat score and chef eric ripert is considered by many to be one of the best chefs of his time his philosophy is printed clearly on each of the menus at the restaurant the fish is the star of the platethe dining options at le bernardin are also quite generous with options available for lunch and dinner and allow diners to choose between a number of prix fixe menus and a la carte dishes while its certainly possible to have a fairly extravagant meal we opted to come in the middle of the day for a slightly more scaled back but nonetheless comprehensive experience reservations were made a month in advance as well although the availability of tables during lunch seem to be better than at dinner regardless tits best to come prepared as its far from just a casual dining experiencethe meal will start diners off with a choice of bread from their bread tray as well as an amuse bouche we were treated to a generous salmon rillette paired with the buttery thin toast points from the three course prix fixe i opted for the seafood truffle pasta and was presented with one of most beautiful and fragrant pasta dishes i have yet to find the tagliatelle pasta was cooked to just the right texture and bite but played second fiddle to the tender pieces of crab lobster and scallop that highlighted the dish all the components were lightly coated in a black truffle emulsion that imparted a distinct flavor in the sauce but held back from overpowering the entire dish for those looking for something a little lighter and brighter the langoustine and sea urchin was a similarly gorgeous dish featuring a thin langoustine carpaccio studded with generous servings of sea urchin all balanced out with a sweet and tart noriapple vinaigretteoriginally for my main i had decided on the pan roasted cod which was served with a coq au vin sauce upon my first bite into the dish however i was taken aback at the acidity in the sauce which wasnt balanced out by anything else in the dish our server upon noting my hesitation at the dish immediately inquired if everything was all right and i told him that i found the sauce too sharp for my tastes he immediately had the dish sent back to the kitchen informing me that the red wine in the coq au vin sauce could be sometimes overwhelming and offered a suggestion for an alternative the black bass surf and turf the latter option was im happy to say one of the best seafood dishes ive yet to have which paired a perfectly cooked filet of black bass with braised veal cheek the dish was dotted with several portions of a creamy light parsnip emulsion and an aromatic broth that featured ginger and a five spice reduction i can still recall how perfectly crisp and thin the skin on the bass was how tender the veal was to cut into and how beautifully the parsnip paired with the lightly spiced broth while i cant speak to the entire menu at le bernardin its impossible to go wrong with this dish and its one im glad i did wind up withas for dessert i ended up going with the black walnut a beautifully plated dish that featured a cylinder of baba au scotch cake traditionally cooked with rum but traditions are meant to be broken caramelized banana and a quennelle of black walnut ice cream it was surprisingly balanced with the darker nuttier flavors contrasting well with the coolness and lightness of the ice cream i think my preference may lie with the slowroasted pear however which took a perfectly poached pear and uniquely elevated it with a beurre noisette tuile and a frozen pear parfait it was a truly refreshing perfectly sweet dessert that featured the pear in numerous forms and texturesi dont think i need to touch too much on the elegance and refinement of the dining room and the professionalism and attentiveness of the service at le bernardin in actuality this review is probably more redundant than anything else but if there is one takeaway from it let it be this go there is good reason that le bernardin stands the test of time and continues to be seen by many as one of the best restaurants in the city if not the world it is a fitting review at least in my opinion and i can only hope to return one day to experience the full dinner rest assured that since moving to nyc this has been nearly completely rectified
im so glad this place is herecorvo has been open for about a month now and in that time theyve had a promotion where every item on their menu is every single item that includes all their coffee products as well as their pastries breakfast sandwiches and other goodies i keep going every day thinking the promotion will end soon but its been a solid month and prices are still the same so not only are the prices great but get this the coffee is too they use la colombe beans and turn out solid lattes regular coffee flat whites or anything youre in the mood for best of all the service is friendly and efficient i occasionally ask for mochas or flavored lattes with very little syrup and they have always been happy to accommodate ive never been disappointed with either my drink or the service part of me hopes that corvo will stay a secret but part of me is happy to see more people discover it
if wine enthusiasts ask bordeaux or burgundy pho enthusiasts similarly ask northern or southern style my answer to the latter is always northern pho bac hanoi house is the only nyc representative so far that makes pho bac i must mention that this review is a long but personally special one to me because i am finally writing a review about pho as a vietnamese to create a certain credibility of this review i need to mention my background i am not the vietnamese who grew up with orange countys cuisine but the vietnamese who spent the entire childhood in vietnam where i often had pho bac northernstylepho made by people from the north basically what i am trying to say is i know what im talking about back to the opening question northern or southern why is it so crucial for this review it is because the majority or may i dare saying all of pho in nyc is the southernstylepho the kind of pho videos you see on youtube by zagat munchies even asians like fung bros are videos about southernstylepho the only popular videodocumented northernstylepho appeared on anthony bourdains show there is nothing wrong about your choice of style but if i liked bordeaux and you served only burgundy theres a less chance that id come back righthere are some main differences northern pho bac traditional noodles flat soft soup clear cooked from cow bones taste mildly sweet bland a hint of black pepper and ginger meat chicken or fat beef to compromise with the soup addition to serving chinese cruller pickled garlic portion medium bowl lots of scallions location local northern vietnam southern pho nam noodles chewy soup cloudy cooked from cow chicken bones and sometimes dried seafood taste sweet rich meat doesnt matter lean or fat the dish is highly fat anyway addition to serving sriracha hoisin side veggies portion humongous bowl sprinkled scallions location anywhere in the world but local northern vietnamhanoi houses pho is not perfectly authentically northern hanoi the most distinctive difference of the styles is the noodles the noodles hanoi house use are absolutely not northern but considering the northern noodles are handmade and no restaurant wants to pioneer i probably shouldnt demand the soup on the other hand is the real deal a very important point to mention here is their price points some people really really need to complain about spending for a pho my total combo of a pho bone marrow chinese cruller tip were if you can pay for a ramen or a pasta whats so wrong about a pho preached about your health then demanded less than for an msg meal only idiots would expect a dinner in a neat topservice restaurant in east village
this review is primarily for the galette des rois yes every year around january french people enjoy the galette des rois tradition even after january many bakeries keep the cakes often even until the end of january when valentines stuff starts coming in so go out and get some galettei personally always find it a bit annoying when people say stuff like this italian place is legit because my moms italian and the pasta sauce is the same etc well sorry im from france and i highly recommend this place does this mean somehow that my opinion trumps those of other just regular americans even if theyve personally eaten like bazillion croissants more than me well duh yes im better than you haha no just joking but yes french people can be snobbythis is the best galette ive eaten in a long time crunchy and flaky and buttery and light on the outside as it should its puff pastry similar to a croissant and warm rich gooey almondy on the inside typical frangipane same often found in almond croissants plus the top design is really nice and the price at person size for person size is spot on kayser only had a person size and it was really didnt like the last cakes i bought at kayser so was very delighted with millefeuille this timedont be shy enjoy the tradition with us they even sell individual slices its basically a giant pie shaped almond croissant so good oh if you dont know the tradition involves sharing the pie with friends and the person who finds the fève bean usually a figurine gets the crown and is the king or queen and if you lose well just keep buying more galettes until you win the crown like i do lolto finish off ive tried other galettes at kayser pain quotidien financier and this is my favorite financier is good but basic millefeuille really kicks it up a notchas for their other offerings they are also very good they have croissants they even offer private classes super pricey if you ask me their namesake millefeuille and other standard cakes and viennoiseries oh and yes they have cups so make sure you get the cups app to get cheaper coffeei really like millefeuille so i definitely wont hesitate next time say to buy a bûche de noel from here yes another french tradition that americans really ought to experience and one you guys just missed btw dont buy from kayser overpriced and mediocre bûches i have really really enjoyed other bûches though from dominique ansel and restaurant benoit they do special orders ceci cela normally is another favorite but their bûches normally dont look very nice
guys super foodtown is the best thing to happen to the neighborhood in quite some time finally a grocery store with a big selection of fresh produce and a meat section where the meat isnt halfspoiled and all dripping meat juices on itself looking at you key foods and the prices dont make you want to straight up punch someone looking at you gristedes they even have some bougie staples like stations for you to grind your own peanut butter and coffee and a sprawling selection of cheeses after youve stuffed yourself with cheese and peanut butter you might be looking to shave some calories and boom a wall full of halo top ice cream you start feeling bad for eating the semifranken food that is halo top and lo and behold another wall full of nourishing bobs red mill products you decide you dont actually feel that bad about eating frankenfood and heyo aisles of fun snack foods have you ever tried coconut jerky i hadnt either before discovering it at this wonderful gem of a grocery store my point is you can find everything you need and also everything you dont need but will thoroughly enjoy right here on st the service is great and the manager who i swear is always working has a frankly admirable amount of hustle in his heart your groceries will be bagged in no time flatthe best news of all free delivery in a country run by a despotic monster in the midst of the cold and dreary winter let food town be the salve your weary soul craves

five senses is my new favorite restaurant in koreatown hands down the line is extremely intimidating as its usually out the door every night but dont worry they move quick here i would not recommend coming here in groups of more than its an optimal if you have a party of and they can seat you quicker our wait for on a saturday evening was around minutes which is amazingthe atmosphere reminds me of a restaurant in chinatown or something they want you out as fast as possible to serve other people so service is a little rushed and frantic i wouldnt come here expecting too much out of service but they still get the job done i dont mind that just means i get seated faster overall service is acceptable but could be better the restaurant is loud and bustling but not so much to the point where you feel the need to scream over the table to talk the music is which is interesting for a restaurant on this streetive eaten here a couple times now and each time the food has been amazing i love me some soups and stews and five senses has a ton to choose from their seolleongtang ox bone broth mul naengmyeon cold noodles in broth and yukgaejang spicy beef stew were all very flavorful and some of the best ive had especially the cold noodles they are a little pricier than their competitors but i guess you pay for the quality and the servings are pretty large i have also had the spicy double fried chicken and its comparable if not better than your usual kyochon or bonchon the outside is very very crispy and it packs a lot more heat than it lookscome for the food ignore the dodgy service i gave them the benefit of the doubt and keep returning because this stuffs the real deal

having lived in nyc for over years now theres been a noticeable good dim sum drought so much so that as a cantonese person i would wait for trips back home to california vancouver or hong kong to fulfill my cravings tim ho wan the well known michelin starred dim sum chain from hong kong was my renewed hope to change thattoday december is the soft opening which will last with staggered hours until its grand opening date of january i arrived a little after and was unfortunately told min later that the the couple in front of me would be the last people that would be seated for lunch i was devastated but the couple in front of me graciously offered to give me their spot in line because they had to go back to work this was a recurring theme considering i didnt get seated until around so plan accordingly they do have a namecell phone service when you check in that will text you when a table is closer to opening up it seemed to be having issues today but when things calm down this would be a great help so you dont have to wait around the entire time and can do some shopping or get a drink nearbythe space isnt the biggest but it feels bright and comfortable i believe it only seats with tables and booths optimized for so no huge round tables here for you and your extended family ive been to one of the tim ho wan locations in hong kong several times and it was also on the smaller sidedespite the craziness of opening day the staff remained friendly and calm front of staff june and christina were great along with our server whose name i didnt get but looked like a young ming tsai more surprisingly was how calm the kitchen staff was viewable through an open kitchen concept they were focused like a welloiled machine and food came out consistently without large waits i loved the beautiful marble lazy susan that the kitchen staff and wait staff use to exchange food we did wait a bit for one dish but i think that was due to it not being put in which has always happened in general at dim sum places with the checklisttallying order methodlike any dim sum place you come for whats good and unique to that specific place the highlight and namesake was of course their baked bbq pork buns they came out hot and fresh out of the oven and were made more delicious because we were so cold and hungry from waiting outside and it was the first thing that arrived at our table the topping was crisp and lightly sweet and the inside was perfectly seasoned being both sweet and savory like a good char siu i also noticed some umami seaweed dashi flavor at one point from what i remember i think the buns here were even better than the ones i had at tim ho wans hk locationother highlights were the shrimp dumplings har gow and the shrimp and chives in rice roll har cherng the shrimp were really fresh sweet and plump again these were served super warm and fresh i generally prefer the shrimp rice rolls to the pork ones and this was the case here as well since the bbq pork rice rolls were a bit forgettable and the pork pieces were cut in large chunks that felt out of place in the dish also if you have an aversion to cilantro dont order the bbq pork rice rolls its common for the meat rice rolls at dim sum places to have cilantro and it exists here as wellfried turnip cakes these were good too not the best ive had but decently seared and the ratio of daikon to flour was good and not overly doughy or plasticy at alldeep fried dumplings with pork and shrimp these have always been a favorite of mine i generally describe these as meat mochi footballs these dont reheat well so id recommend eating them here instead of taking them homevegetable spring rolls really good with lots of mushroom flavor only downside was these were on the oily side could fry these better or let the oil soak out a bit moreanother unique thing here was the french toast with custard it tastes like a fried souffle sandwich filled with custardi was really impressed overall especially given that it was the first day of its soft opening i could feel how much work was put into the desire for this place to be successful from the food to the service i went into this experience just hoping to have a solid dim sum place finally in nyc but somehow i left feeling happier than i expected i wasnt expecting to have a sense of camaraderie in line with fellow diners or that i would feel a sense of warmth from all of the staff especially with how crazy busy today was you know what i mean when youre accustomed to chinese or dim sum restaurants where attitude and opentable make sure you get online at midnight days in advance if you want sushi bar experience sushi bar or dining room table i highly suggest sushi bar experience chef nakazawa interacts directly with those at the sushi bar telling us history behind the different types of sushi and we can take pictures of the entire experience also you can watch all the sous chefs prepping and how they work in tandem at an extra dollars its worth it especially for those who like to take picturesdesignated times for sushi bar and whichever one you decide make sure to get there minutes early as you want to get the center seat right in front of chef nakazawa get used to eating with your hand if you didnt know already each item is offered one at a time with the correct amount of wasabi in it already and you pick it up with your fingers i repeat eat with your fingers the chopsticks are offered to pick up a slice of ginger to cleanse the palate and prep yourself for the next piece dont worry for germ lovers a finger napkin is provided to wipe your fingers after each sushi piece sushi bar experience when you walk in you find the place stunning and it lives up to its money signs the place is immaculate all staff is super cordial they slide all chairs inout for you all staff are wearing business professional aka suits and well groomed the staff is just on point with everything in terms of refilling waters coming by and asking if we need anything else the omakase is a piece sushi sorry need to eat rice for those noncarb eaters the items are offered one at a time chef nakazawa does an amazing job explaining what type of fish each one he is offering us and tends to interact with the sushi bar really well he does a good job walking back and forth so everyone can have a fair shot and see what he is pointing at the sushi is just immaculate the fish is indescribable of the fish is from japan and are changed seasonally based on japans weather and depending on whats fresh out there the other is domestic i dont know how much i can rave if you have read this far but the craftsmanship by chef nakazawa and his staff are absolute artist when it comes to the sushi each piece is amazingly laid out my favorite piece was teh egg custard sushi this is probably what he is known best for for those who watched jiro dreams of sushi chef nakazawa was the guy who practiced for years on how to make the egg custard sushi every day i can absolutely say he perfected it dollarsper person for sushi bar experience and for dining room experience sake pairing an additional dollars for those who want the full experience expect to drop at least for two people including tiptaxalcohol
having never done one of these escape rooms i sort of had preconceived notions a mix of the movie saw and a cheesy office room space with a few locks to open well that wasnt the case here from the very beginning when you enter the first door to the maze of hakainato get the backstory you are immersed in their world the basic jist is that you are to enter a japanese maze to both escape and rescue a boy who got lost in it along the way you encounter demons and must solve clues to get from the starting point until the very end through various rooms i enjoyed the dim lighting and that the clues were very creative and went beyond what you may have initially thought being in a group of was nice as we worked together and different people pieced together different riddlesclues i did enjoy the hints that were given they were good at putting you on the right track the space itself was very well put together with impressive japanese artifacts and letters decorating the walls and some very fun props that totally fit the mood we completed the missions with seconds to spare afterward i enjoyed speaking with the staff on our opinions on what to improve and what we liked but from my friends who had been to make quest rooms like this they said this was amongst their favorite this would be a great teambuilding activity fun for a group of friends or anyone that wants to escape from their phones and reality for hr to get caught up in an adventure i would surely try some of their other room experiences around nyc

rudys is a quintessential dive bar so as long as you dont go here expecting anything else youll have a great time the seats are upholstered with red duct tape there is limited seating the entire place smells like spilled beer and the service isnt exactly lavish the nice thing about rudys is that it doesnt pretend to be something its not it is unapologetically dirty and crowded but the drinks are dirt cheap the vibe is friendly and you get a free hot dog with every drink favorites include the house blonde ale only for a whole pitcher and the beer and a shot deals there are a few including one called the mexican hat dance for only they have some good beers in bottles and in drafts too including the lagunitas ipa one of my favorite beers for a mere you have to ask for the hot dog but make no mistake theyre totally free and while they werent exactly gourmet they hit the spot and were great with a beer ive been wanting to check this place out for a long time and it did not disappoint oh tip they have a back door to rudys back yard that allows you to drink your cheap beers in a more open outdoor location really nice during the warm months
