im so happy theres a cat cafe in new york it basically saves me a trip to japan except in japan those cat cafes dont charge hourly but alas the money is going to a good cause i came in late afternoon on tuesday and this place was empty great for me because that means all the cats are mine when you walk in they tell you its per half hour a dollar more than when they opened you pay at the end and they warned me when my half hour was almost done although i dont think they warn you normally so keep a watch on your clock you then sign a waiver take off your shoes sanitize and play with all the cats you desire you can also order drinks and snacks and the people will deliver it to you they provide you toys that you can use to play with the cats and an array of seats and tables you can sit at to watch all the cats you want i was reading some of the other reviews and one of the reasons why people wouldnt rate it so low is because the cats are asleep and not as enthusiastic when they see people i wonder why that is oh its because theyre cats not dogs cats have all different personalities some can be very trusting and loving and others need time to warm up to you so you might need some patience but the workers there are knowledgeable to tell you which cats are more willing to play with you which cats you can pick up and which cats are more of a lone wolf they know each cat and the story of how they got to the shelter and theyre all up for a forever home this is an amazing place and im going to bring all my friends here who need a furry little friend i mean who wouldnt benefit from a cat in their life

rorys i have been going to rory dolans way before my yelping days existed located on mclean ave this traditional irish pub has been around since and boasts an inviting exterior that slightly resembles a castle with just as an inviting interior the venue is large and well laidout and like most irish pubs ive encountered they have beautiful waterford crystals displayed in lit glassed in wood armoires throughout which aides in the homey warm atmosphere upon entering the first thing you see is a large rectangular bar surrounded by plenty of booths a few hightop tables plus a raised dining area towards the back of the restaurant there are also well placed flat screen tvs and projection screens spread throughout the restaurant to catch all the events of the day plus your local games aside from their well stocked bar like most pubs food offerings are available through a diverse menu covering all irish american and italianamerican food staples in my opinion rorys food is not overwhelmingly the best but you cant go wrong with a burger salad or some type of veggieproteincarb entree to satiate and soak up your adult beverage rorys has hostessed many a good time of birthday parties opportunites of meeting new people mingled and jigged at many st pattys days parties plus theres also the obligatory friday night move all the dinner tables towards the back of the restaurant and setup the dj for that evenings dance party leading to many upon many good times very friendly and welcoming serviceoutdoor sidewalk seating available party room for special occasionsmetered street and valet parking availablehappy hour on fridays onlydj on friday and saturday nightscome into rory dolans solo or with a crew you are bound to find most of what you need and have a good time

kidding it was one of the most amazing culinary experiences i have had to date there is no other restaurant food or service that i find to be even somewhat comparablei probably cannot add much more to chose the daily menu i discussed my preferences with the server along with some dietary restrictions that were making it difficult for me to choose one option from each course she said that she would speak with the chef about other options we could do i was hesitant because i did not want to modify the beauty and flavors already created by the chef for each serving but the server assured me that they want me to have a great experience and that they are very happy to accommodate almost any dietary restriction or requestthe chef then suggested two items from the first course in lieu of one from the second course as i could not eat anything from the second course the chef also swapped out some of the items i could not eat with items that i could i cannot possibly explain the food nirvana as i free as the standard dessert had gluten my dessert was teeny tiny cubes of cantaloupe on a bed of stone barns honey and with some ginger they also brought out halves of various seasonal plums on the same honey i really cannot adequately describe how beautiful it is to taste fresh fruits and vegetables that are prepared in a loving way to bring out the best in eachin addition to the food the chocolate breads the doughy inside is like the baguette tender moist and with that same airy quality another wondrous touch were the diced orange peels in this bread i dug out one of the minute pieces it was only slightly sweet seemed more preserved than candied then i dug out one of the small pieces of chocolate a smooth dark chocolate without a strong smell and not in large chunks the almonds are whole toasted fresh and crunchy i put my nose to the velvety bread and smelled yeast not the cocoa i expected or the expresso powder i was sniffing for gural loves his bread so much he does not let any added ingredient dominate the taste of his bread but he has mastered baking alchemy along with matchmaking ingredients when i ate the bread as the sum of all its parts the orange and almonds accentuated the cocoa and chocolate and a wonderfully addictive chocolate bread emerged i almost ate half the loaf in one sitting my bff showed more restraint but raved about this bread tooalmond chocolate croissant another rich creation the layers crackle not as sharply as with the almond croissant perhaps because the filling was a wetter paste a mix of the almonds and sugar and melted chocolate and whatever goodness gural bakes in i expected a more intense chocolate flavor this one tasted more like an almond cream with chocolate flavor a lovely breakfast pastry but the plain almond one i thought surpassed it in texture and taste but dont shie from buying this it is deliciouscaramel apple brioche a pretty ring of brioche with apple pieces on top this pastry caught my eye at the video was made about new yorks trendiest new food at pokeworks lines went out the door and hype was blown out of proportion nothing gets people going like a viral video about sushi burritos in hopes of avoiding crowds i went to chelseas wisefish on a sunday morninghaving had both pokeworks and wisefish my vote goes to wisefish pokeworks is good dont get me wrong but wisefish is better you can taste the difference in fish quality and feel the difference in friendliness both places are similar in terms of setup which consists of chipotlestyle byobowls and preset options as well as ingredients and prices a regular bowl at either will run you about not cheap but itll fill you uppokewisefish keeps it simple with protein choices between tuna salmon and tofu beyond brown and white rice you also have the option to get zucchini noodles as a base i got them out of curiosity along with rice and was pleasantly surprised i think of the zucchini more as a topping since it complemented the fish so well and imo rice is a must with poke you then have your choice of toppings which range from scallions to avocado cream to fried onion finish it off with a sauce you can go with a spicy option like wasabi shoyu or spicy citrus shoyu or keep it classic with soy sauce and sesame oil my suggestion for poke is to always go simple rather than complicated too many toppings make it flavoroverload and poke should be all about the fishatmospherei think my favorite thing about wisefish was not the food but the people the girl checking me out was friendly and very informative telling me how they make an effort to locally source their fish and keep it authentic i really appreciated the enthusiasm and genuine interest in her store on that note the store itself is nicely set up with a long table down the middle and a couple of window seats below hanging lights overall id love to come back the next time im craving poke in the city ill be here

love jivamukti yoga the space seems very authentic the two things i noticed about the facility are the clean floors and the high quality of their mats not only are the mats complimentary for members and drop ins but they are also cleaned right after each use with their laundry machines the term jivamukti means individual liberation jivamukti yoga school embraces the philosophy of ahimsa bhakti yoga raja yoga karma yoga nada yoga dhyana and chanting the instructors here are very professional and they make sure each student receives a hands on adjustment while the breaths are also counted for awarenessi love the spiritual warrior class it is an hour long and unlike most practices it starts off with an inversion and a backbendits different but it works the mats are lined up against the wall and the flows are simple but the way they sequenced it does work a sweat jivamukti open is an hour and minutes long that starts off with oms a chant and a philosophical speech before the physical asanas begin unlike the spiritual warrior class the inversions and the backbends are saved toward the later part of the class when the heats are built the practice ends with a seated meditation follow by savasana on the downside theres only one shower and no mirror in the changing room and the lockers are really really small and its for rental onlyif you have a large bag it wouldnt fit they also have a gluten free vegan café attached its cute but some items are overpriced like to for a quesadillaoverall for someone who must have her inversions and backbends to call it a full practice you cant go wrong with jivamukti however it would be amazing if we can have hanumansana and gong savasana added starsps they also have mysore ashtanga

there arent too many places in the city that have a burger that can stand against salvation burgers salvation burger think steak on a bun like peter lugers and minetta tavern this burger belongs on that listfor those that dont know after winning separate michelin stars at two previous restaurants spotted pig and the breslin primarily for the burger offered at each james beard winning chef april bloomfield decided to open a joint in midtown dedicated to the burger and it does not disappointbloomfield selected her cattle ranch and slaughterhouse personally upstate uses only locally sourced ingredients has a few butchers in the basement all in the name of having complete control over the burger and its contents the meat on the burger is expertly cut and ground inhouse with a high fat ratio that is tough to get right from distributor or store bought meatthe burger patty was about the diameter of a hockey puck and about thicker we had in our party and ordered salvation burgers all medium rare they all came out hot and fresh all cooked to medium rare perfectly all topped with the same crispy onions and perfectly toasted sesame bun top and bottom the flavor of the meat shone through seasoned minimally with salt and pepper and maybe a few other undistinguishable items but focused solely on bringing out the flavor of the meatbloomfield cooks all of the meat over a woodfired grill that is unheard of for a restaurant of this size that is pumping out this many burgers it added a tiny bit of smokiness that complimented well with the onionsaside from the burgers the mcdonalds inspired thin shoestring fries were spot on and the shakes omfg the shakes were amazing i highly recommend the toasted marshmallow shake which captures the caramelized marshmallow taste in a cup lined with caramel sauce and thick vanilla ice creameverything was perfect but there were some bad points on our trip the server lost our name in the app used to track tables when we went back after dropping our name to check they looked it up and twas nowhere to be found they did end up hooking us up with a table immediately but what if we never came back to check and just waited for the textthe place is pricey with the salvation burger a whopping i think it was worth it being in the upper echelon of burgers in the city but damn good burgers can be found for much less in the city elsewherethe ambiance of the place at least at night is a little dark for my taste more nightclubby than fancy burger joint pop some candles in there or something people want to see each other and this amazing burgerstaff was well trained and helpful despite only being open for weeks at the time of my visitoverall stars which rounds up to a rare from me for salvation burger i hope you get another michelin star chef bloomfield you definitely deserve it on this one
id been looking for a way to vary my workout routine once i felt like id reached a plateau for some time now women all around me have been raving and going crazy about pure barre im here to join the crazy train and support all of the hype about this form of exercise to be fair you could find a cheaper barre class at another gymfranchise that isnt trademarked like pure barrepure body vixen crossfit zumbabut i went with pure barre and signed up for their new client special for which grants you access to unlimited classes for one month then youre required to either pay for individual classes to the tune of or sign up for a real membership which i have not yet looked into that said i love pure barre bronxville i would recommend going to a breaking down the barre workshop which i had the pleasure of doing with mariellen this workshop is great for those of you who havent yet taken a barre class so that the instructor can really take the time to demonstrate the proper form and technique i say this because classes are fastpaced and expensive so you definitely dont want to waste your time and money being too far behind the other people in your class youll walk in take off your shoes and be greeted warmly by one of many women with a friendly smile classes are done without shoes and in socks so you can buy your handy pure barre socks with foot grips for in any studio yes its another expensive thing and you probably can get through your classes with your normal gym socks but i find that the grips help yes i could buy my own grippy spiderwoman socks but i just bought a bunch at pure barre and called it a day classes are challenging but thats why you came here right you want to earn those muscle shakes when youre on the bar come into your seat now lift and tuck and squeeze and tuck im actually obsessed with this program you might think that nothing is being accomplished by moving parts of your body just an inch but you are really working i dare anyone who thinks they are in prime shape to take these classes and not feel like theyre working muscles theyve been neglecting so far ive had class with mariellen erica jill p stacey and sian all of these ladies have been wonderfully helpful to a beginner like me and have taken the time to answer my questions thoughtfully i feel like im really getting my money and times worth and i love the environment im sure there are larger pure barre locations in more densely populated areas but the pure barre bronxville has only one studio and that seems to be sufficient downloading the app makes it super easy to sign up for classes which you must do if you expect to participate walkins are allowed but not for platform but its more likely than not that you wont find space in the walkin of your choice because theres usually a wait list before that as i mentioned pure barre is trendy and everybody wants to get in there to feel the burn and build that lean muscle i have no regrets besides not starting this program sooner i feel that its a challenging supplement to my usual routine and i noticed an additional lb drop in my weight after alternating pure barre with my cardio and lifting routine i intend to continue that and really push myself pure barre instructors will help to push their clients too one of my favorite things ive ever heard in class was dont let your body decide when you give up its all about trying to get yourself to a point where you can mentally push past the pain and the muscle spasms once you do youre goldmy cousins wife came with me the other day and we had a blast no im lying we both were dying and having uncontrollable leg spasms but dammit it was worth it seriously i plan to be a pure barre junkie some day and cant wait until i can call myself a member of the club this studio is clean located right in town and youll leave every class feeling great about you what more can you ask for

mere two blocks away i arrived to this westside location a few minutes before and there at the empty entryway were two patrons who at that exact moment were being directed to their table by the hostess perfect timing the efficient hostess returned promptly and immediately guided me to the last seat at the modern looking communal counter little did i realize i lucked out getting seated so quickly just like the east village location every single customer is greeted with a japanese welcome which thank goodness isnt as loud and intrusive here on the westside considering its more intimate and warm atmosphere i was tempted to order an appetizer but i know ramen servings are always plentiful so i chose to have ramen only the drum heart ramen the listed ingredients looked like a perfect combination that i knew i would enjoy as i waited for my meal i looked around the counter and it seemed as though i may have been the only one ordering this soup and now i started thinking that i may have made the wrong choice but once my order arrived and i took my first taste of this soup the umami jumped right out of that spoon offering hot spicy sweet sour salty earthy fragrant rich bold unctuousnessesoh my goodnessoh my goodness it was a titillating palate dancer of flavors which consisted of fresh herbs pork belly cilantro and all others including the largest perfectly poached egg i have ever seen all of these surrounded in a broth that had this look of charcoal and look of deep dark chocolate which looked scary and intriguing all at the same time all of my senses were engaged in this ramen experience i never finish an entire bowl of ramen but for this i had to i will say that i am glad i came in not reading any prior reviews that may have swayed me to try what the masses had been ordering my decision turned out to be a very good one indeed for an impromptu visit i was happy with everything the impeccable service of the waiters hostess bussers chefs all efficient and friendly and run this operation like a well oiled machine an experience i would love time and time again my last note upon leaving a little less than an hour later i could barely get out of the immediately in awe of this new set up after a few uses of this togiharu petty knife i was sold i had to have oneto my great surprise my wonderful mother took action before i could and purchased a togiharu petty and santoku knife set for me thanks ma d to make sure the knives would stay as magnificent as they were on the day i received them i traveled to korin to purchase proper wooden sheaths and ask about sharpening stones all i can say is i received the most educational and pleasant help ive ever received when shopping for knives or their accessories the attendants are so knowledgeable and friendly from the moment you get there they greet you and guide you through the store answering all your questions and giving you all the information you need to pick the right knives and accessories truly a serviceafter a few weeks of working with my new togiharus im so thankful to have come across them what absolutely amazing knives theyre relatively lightweight have a handle which fits comfortably in my tinywiny hand and have a slightly thinner bland then european style knives thus allowing them to be more easily sharpened and allowing you to perform precision cuts with ease butcher meat and fish like nobodies business hot knife through butter and not crack root vegetables when cutting just be sure to not leave this knives wet or exposed to acid for too long they will rust and discolormy advice to you if you are a culinary professional take the time to travel to this playland youll be there for longer than you think and leave with a lighter wallet but youll have a blast if youre a home culinary enthusiast still pay korin a visit youll find flatware that will be perfect for your next extravagant dinner party learn a ton about knives and how to care for them and maybe even get a show from their inhouse sharpener working his magic on the giant stone this place is so awesome

when i was growing up my mother used to make me sandwiches for lunch she was a very hard working woman who did her best to put a roof over the kids heads and made sure we were never hungry being as busy as she was she didnt always have the time to make the fanciest sandwiches or come up with a diverse meal plan for us we were on a budget lunch for school was often simply ham and cheese in between two slices of white breadi ate that for years or at least i tried to unless i was extremely hungry sometimes i would just throw the sandwich away im not sure what type of ham she would get for these sandwiches but eventually i just couldnt eat ham anymore i think i told my mother to stop making these sandwiches for me and she never did again i was a very unappreciative kid to this year ive never willfully ordered ham of any kind bacon pork belly and the kind are a different storyfast forward years later and im told about one of the best bakeries in new york cityarcade deciding on what sandwich to get i wanted something on their famous baguettes but when i read the menu i saw the ingredients in the sandwich cheese butter and hamnot wanting any other type of bread for my sandwich i swallowed my old hatred for ham after snapping pictures of this plain looking sandwich i delve in a big bite for this crunchyontheoutside slightlychewyontheinside baguette my teeth sunk in getting into each layer first into the subtle butter then into the cheese and the ham simultaneouslythe harmony of all four simple ingredients in my mouth had me wondering what i was eating was this how sandwiches were supposed to taste with ham this could possibly be the only ham sandwich i can ever eat againnow i understand what my mother had to do to feed three children at the same time while holding down a fulltime job working overtime and trying to get her degree at the same time this sandwich made me appreciate that it brought back memories of sandwiches i ate for years and threw away for yearsthank you mom for all your sacrifice and thank you arcade bakery for helping me appreciate her
weve been back here at least four more times and we love it every time the service is always so warm and friendly and now they take online reservations yall need to get on thatsince our first visit weve tried the sweetened nuts like praline nuts but honestly the cart is better and the kale dip with assorted breads would be better warm but the breads are funthe pineapple and pancetta flatbread is crispy light and delicious it reminded me of the rectangle pizza i used to get in grade school with the cubed pepperoni but far tastier the boy adores the peppercorn burger but my heart remains with the benson burger beets beef lifeits a shame not more people seem to know about the churro ice cream sandwich which has swirls of fried cinnamon sugared disks with vanilla ice cream and honey drizzle somehow light least it felt that way because we inhaled it and oh so satisfyingbenson we love you will be back soon
i put off getting a haircut because im living off student loans and couldnt afford one however my ends were getting atrocious and it was either spend the money or cut it myself i think ill spend the moneyi made the appointment about three hours before no problemtapping into my precious loans was well worth it the shampoo was not rushed at all it was very relaxing and felt great their shampooing stations are extraordinarily comfortable it didnt hurt my neck like most placesthe man who cut my hair lam did an incredible job as well he radiated confidence i gave him minimal directions and let him do his thing what was most impressive for me is that he styled my hair with only a brush and blowdryer virtually no product that i remember ive never seen a stylist do this before and ive never seen my hair cooperate so well furthermore this is the first time that ive gotten bangs and not hated them i love emand perhaps most importantly no small talk lam let me sit in comfortable silence with my own happy thoughts and didnt force me to have a conversation its an introverts paradise doverall my cut was before tip i will definitely be back
how to survive a tone house wear long pants that cover your knees unless you dont mind having your knees slide over the come min early so you can stretch the warm up is tough here and you will be sprinting like crazy so stretch its about team its all about teamwork you cheer everyone on you cheer till the last person touches that finish line show up workout hard drop dead in between then get up again then drop dead then get up again finish strong finish proud go home and sit on couch other useful there are cubby holes for your bags and hooks for your coats there is a unisex bathroom but no you are provided with a towel and a bottle of water there is also a water first timers get a special rate of you can sign up for classes tone house is on the second floortone house is the hardest workout in new york i take all sorts of classes at equinox run marathons but tone house was like random hard workout class its like your usual bootcamp class but on crack to be honest i was so nervous coming here i already felt like puking in my uber i dont even feel that nervous going for a job interview i got there early and started stretching i didnt know anybody going there obviously there were some others who showed up with their friends but the camaraderie and team spirit is so great that everyone will cheer for you that you will feel as if the whole team is your friend my coach was tamara and she was excellent half of my class happened to be newbies aka first timers so i felt a little less intimidatedwell as i mentioned above the warm up isnt some simple stretching the warm up is tough according to tamara if you can survive the work out you can survive the class we spent the first min sprinting over these blocks with the faster people going first and the slower people behind the faster people will catch up with the slower people so you better keep running you will have to jump over the hurdles and also jump over them sideways you will even do push ups in between those hurdles after the first min i was pouring in sweat and panting now for the real work out we did lots of bear crawls we also got into a plank position put sliders under both feet and dragged ourselves from one end of the room to the other with our arms tamara also divided us into little groups of people and each group would take turns doing certain exercises putting the gliders under your hands and pushing them with your legs getting down on all and hoping forward with your legs then moving your hand forwards then hopping again till the end of the room etc while doing these the rest of the class would cheer you on i wasnt the fastest at moving around on gliders under my feet while holding a plank position and trying to pull myself forward in fact i had to take lots of breaks on my knees which is why you should wear long pants that cover your knees and ended up being the slowest of my group i must have been with ultra fit athletes or something what got me through doing laps was the wonderful team cheering me on tamara even came beside me and did it with me and helped me get to the finish line i still remember standing up with sweat dripping down my red face and everyone was clapping for me telling me i had done a good job there was one girl in my group who hid in the toilet at times because she was scared to do the exercises my philosophy is to suck it up and do it and finish strong it doesnt matter how old you are or how fat thin you are just do it mind over matter however i would strongly recommend being in decent shape if not you will probably end up puking we also did push ups with gliders under our hands the last set of exercises that we did was lunging back and to the side followed by jumping lunges i have fairly strong legs i can run marathons however tone house had me burnt out i realized my quads were so exhausted that i could barely jump my jumps were getting lower and lower haha i was actually shocked that my legs were this tiredfinally we got into a circle and did all sorts exercises like burpees push ups running in place etc you feel like a hero when you are done i was so tired i had to outside and sit somewhere just to catch my breath i felt as if i was still panting and sweating min later yes its that hard of a work out its no joke i came home and sat on the couch for another mintone house takes working out to a whole new level you might want to cancel partying plans after tone house because sitting on the couch after that with a bottle of wine and some cheese trader joes is nearby is the way to do it

out a new spin studio on classpass i said absolutely lets do it i get somewhat complacent in my class grove with my classpass routine so i love when people recommend a new place admittedly i havent ventured up to harlem for anything besides dinosaur bbq but this was worth the trip and i was down for an exploration it is conveniently located right by the so if coming up from midtown or uws it is pretty easy seriously dont be lazy explore your city the studio reminds me of a former beauty salon or barbershop just without the mirrors and salon chairs everywhere you will see what i mean you walk downstairs into a reception area where an extremely friendly front desk girl checks you in from there you walk into the spin room where there are cubbies for your things as well as bathrooms in the back to change the bikes are all brand new they have baskets for those wearing sneakers and clips for any pros with their spd shoes i love that they have the monitors on them so i can think in terms of rpm while i spin it makes for a much more efficient workout harder to slack off your bike comes prepared with water and a towel for you i love that personal touch the studio is also extremely clean i understand you are there to sweat but the last thing i want it to grip onto a bike and have to worry about the sweat residue of the person before you you wont have that worry here at all the class i took was a reggae themed ride what is that you may ask well you are spinning out to reggae music do i know much about reggae no but who cares it was dope if you are new to spin thats totally cool this place is probably perfect for you i love themed rides and reggae made for great spin music due to its controlled nature specifically it was awesome for climbing the instructor did a great job of getting new riders set up and comfortable on their bikes before walking them through the different hand positions with no mirrors it is a judgement free zone in here you focus on yourself the music and the spinning it was a tough class but definitely a good kind of tough i walked out of there with some happy jello legs it felt greatafter class the owner tameca greeted everyone with a nice little surprise of bananas energy bars and coconut water such a nice treat not sure if that is standard but definitely unique to other classes i have taken also the reason i didnt collapse before dinner later thanks again loved the class
besfren is located withinbehind the korean ginseng store on the corner of and blink and you could miss itseriously this is some of the best asian dessert ever after a meal at her name is han around the corner my friends and i dashed real quick around the corner to make it minutes before they close at on sunday this place serves all sorts of baked goods and sweets from truffles to canelle to petit fours they also sell gelato by il laboratorio del gelato however the piece de resistance the roll cakes in multiple flavors and the chiffon donuts so many things so little room in my stomachi had bites of my friends roll cakes and oh my goodness gracious i was wishing i had gotten those the jasmine green tea is different because it actually tastes like jasmine tea not just the normal hardly flavored matcha flavor the salted caramel is the perfect marriage of salty and sweet the cream for both are not too sweet a very fresh milky flavor and filled with vanilla beans which are my favorite i will most definitely have every single flavor of these the next time i stop by this dessert shopfor myself i ordered the jasmine green tea chiffon donut which was unique kind of its nothing like a donut at all really more like an asian pound cake it tastes like the honey cakes you can get at the asian supermarket and is a little moist with some sort of honey or sugary sap the green tea flavor isnt as pronounced in this cake but its still very delicious though sweeter than the roll cakes the white chocolate on top makes the donut a little hard to eat since its hard on top but nevertheless its a great dessert i just prefer the outstanding roll cakes morenot much seating inside so id suggest this as a take out dessert place theyve also got a nice array of interesting hot and cold drinks on their menu also ranging from ginseng lattes to grapefruit yuzu teawill definitely be back

to those who have yet to experience the joy that is raclette i ask you this why the hell notto put it simply raclette is freshly melted cheese poured over some potatoes cornichon pickles and cured meats it may not sound delicious in words but trust me on this you have to try it first raclette is the size of a broom closet only a slight exaggeration seating around people only but the size of the cheese wheels and the hospitality of the servers is not to be underestimated orders of the raclette come with a refill of cheese which the server pours straight onto your plate from the hot cheese wheel which sits under heat lamps in between servings each time the server comes around with the wheel you cant help but stare and admire the chemistry that went into putting this yellow gooey deliciousness on your platehere is my recommendation for diners at raclette make a reservation did i mention this place is small grab up to seven friends bring a couple bottles of wine and simply enjoy

so who grew up the bronx and didnt take a school trip here probably no one okay maybe someone but odds are if you live in nyc or the surrounding areas youve been here at least once the bronx zoo is deeply intertwined with the history of the borough itself opened in the zoo is owned by the wildlife conservation society wcs does work all around the world and they also ownoperate four other nyc parks central park zoo queens zoo prospect park zoo and the new york aquarium at acres the bronx zoo is the largest park wcs runs and is also the location of their headquarters theres a lot to see and do you definitely get your moneys worth with the amount of animals youll see they have a good representation of most types of wildlife some of my favorite exhibits are jungle world congo gorilla forest the sea lion pool and the sea bird aviary its a lot of walking so wear comfortable shoes though they have a shuttle that goes from one side of the zoo to the other which i believe they charge for food options are okay there are concession stands throughout the park and a large counter service eatery called the dancing crane cafe located in the center of the zoo for something less runofthemill i would bring my own foodsnacks theres also a large gift shop in the center of the park where you can pick up your bronx zoo memorabilia and a stuffed snake the zoo is pretty accessible there are four entrances and four parking lots they charge for parking additionally its not a far walk from the subways metro north and city buses wednesday is suggested donation aka free day though you may be tempted the crowds are crazy so i would avoid it admission isnt exactly cheap but its worth it the bronx zoo is definitely a place to visit at least once definitely makes other zoos pale in comparison

i have a long history with scarpetta when i was a young deer in headlights at years old a little baby fawn in my first year of ever living in manhattan i came here for dinner with some friends there is no sign in front of the restaurant and i completely forgot the namewhere this restaurant was i always did remember it as the best spaghetti i ever hadfast forward to when i moved to miami and dined at scarpetta where this glorious spaghetti again touched my mouth i instantly remembered the flavors as being from the same restaurant in nyc i finally realized that it was scarpetta that i had dined with that lovely eveningever since then i have been to the scarpetta in la vegas miami and back in nyc i have never had a negative experience at all in this restaurant ever that is pretty hard to pull off the food is extremely consistent and absolutely delicious raw yellowtail light and refreshing although i wish there was some ponzu sauce or a bit more flavor to it thats just my opinion a lot of people like it the more traditional way with less sauces chilled corn soup i was never a fan of cold soup until having this dish at scarpetta it changed the game and now i love chilled soups it has the perfect texture and flavor its not too heavy but not too light either scallops amazing but you only get so be prepared it is a smaller dish spaghetti to die for period duck foie gras ravioli awesome dish but very very rich heavenly theres nothing else i can really say about scarpetta other than consuming all the carbs here is actually worth it and i dont say that about many italian restaurants yum

dinner was absolutely fantastic made a reservation for a thursday night about a week early and had no problem getting a table i love the ambiance of the place you can tell its been around for a long time the wait staff is extremely nice and attentive the oysters were delicious and fresh the steak au poivre was perfection i got it cooked medium rare and it was spot on the peppercorn crust and sauce give it an incredible flavor the spinach and fries that come with it are also delicious the lamb was tasty and cooked perfectly but couldve used a little more flavor the profiteroles were insane you have to get these they look dense but theyre light and airy and the chocolate sauce is insane i found myself eating it straight from the gravy boat this isnt a cheap place for dinner but for a celebration as was mine its a great spot that everyone will enjoy

hale and hearty please open a store in the bronx no not just in the bronx but specifically in throggs neck okayi confess i am a soup lover i kid you not i could have soup days a year but only with one caveat there has to be a multitude of varieties and thats what hale and hearty provides a multitude of varieties aside from soups hale and hearty offers a choice of premade sandwiches plus an option to createyourown salad eh for me id rather just have my soup thank you very much thank you executive chef bruce rogers for bringing your philosophy of if you liked it as a kid youll like it as a soup basically it seems his thought process is any knife and fork meal could be basically turned into a soup and did so by creating different varieties that are constantly rotating on the menu boardto help you choose theres a dietary breakdown showing either vvegetarian llowfat or ddairy plus samples are offered to also narrow down your decision samples have helped me expand my favorites to curried eggplant lentil ginger butternut squash chicken pot pie tomato cheddaryummm tomato cheddar lobster bisque vegetarian split pea green yellow split pea with smoked bacon morrocan chicken and so many more this location during lunch hours can have lines out the door but the employees at the soup counter and the register are good at what they do and get you in and out quick fast and in a hurry upon checkout dont forget to get your green bean card stamped so you can cashin on a free soup after a bunch of visits soup is good food

overly sweet but instead it was just the right balance of citrus sweetness and whiskey flavor i really enjoyed itas i sat at the bar i looked around the bar area which includes several comfortable circular booths and tall tables the bar area alone could accommodate a party the decor manages the hat trick of looking sophisticated but not pretentious the combination of dark wood white counters medium tone furniture and dim lighting creates a comfortable atmosphere that feels rich but not in an off putting manner the environment lends itself to everything from after work drinks with colleagues to a dateeventually my friends began to arrive and we all got to talking so much so we didnt realize that it was taking a rather long time to get to our table we had a reservation i highly recommend you make one the manager came up to us and was very gracious offering us the use of the private dining room near the bar area dubbed the rockefeller room since they had made us wait so long we of course accepted and happily sat down for a very different experience than we had expectedthe rockefeller room could easily accommodate a small office party of about people there is a large round table with a huge lazy susan in the middle there is a flat screen tv mounted on the wall and tasteful decor is the order of the day in the brightly lit room our waiter was absolutely professional and on point the entire night it wasnt just a matter of making sure our glasses were full of water his manner and event he way he addressed us spoke volumes about the training the staff had gone through we were all very impressedokay enough talk about the room and bar etc what did i eat heres a list of what i got to havefilet mignonnot wanting to be a complete glutton i went with the filet mignon medium rare the steak was cooked and seasoned perfectly while you can order items on top of the steak such as black truffle butter i wanted it straight to taste it in its most pure form im really glad i did when i cut the meat it was like butter and it was perfectly tender there was just the right amount of seasoning to make your taste buds happy but not overwhelm them it was also truly medium rare with pink in the middlejalapeno au gratina side dish this comes in a rather large bowl and there was enough that all six people at the dinner were able to get a couple forkfuls of this spicy dish jalapenos generally can go two ways either there is a kick or there isnt in this dish there definitely was along with some savory flavorparmesan truffle friesother restaurants have this and ive had it many times most of the time they are shoestring fries and theres not a lot of substance to them not so here these fries were huge and the cheese layer was obvious from several feet away these were absolutely addicting be warned you cant just eat a couplecreamed spinachwhat could have been a typical creamed spinach is elevated by a smokey element inside the dish most of us agreed it was likely bacon but there were no bacon bits to be found whatever the case may be this was a very uncommon creamed spinach that was full of flavorblack truffle mac n cheesei only got to have one bite of this but it was full of flavor the cheese was creamy and salty and the truffle flavor was definitely assertive ten layer carrot cakea signature dessert this cake was truly layers it was a literal tower of goodness the cake was so moist that you could push a fork through all ten layers and it didnt tip over it tasted delicious and surprisingly had no raisins in itchocolate peanut butter piepeanut butter mousse and bittersweet chocolate ganache come together to make one of the most delicious desserts ive had in ages the mousse is perfectly delicate but full of flavor while the ganache gives just the right amount of sweetness to balance the savory mousse special shout out to the coffee and bread basket both of which could easily be overlooked in any restaurant but here they were exceptional the bread basket had amazing pretzel sticks fresh baked and the coffee was french pressedi really enjoyed my experience at ocean prime and i cant wait to go back

this is by far one of the best indian restaurants ive visited time and time again they never disappoint whether we come for the lunch buffet or a la carte the staff is always pleasant and attentive the bathrooms are always clean and weve never had a problem getting a table the lunch buffet has a wonderful selection of various curry dishes vegetable dishes and tandoori the price is right at on weekdays and on weekends they usually have one or two desserts my favourites being the halwa carrot pudding gulab jamun sweet dumplings and the kheer rice pudding every time we visit we leave full and satisfied their samosas have gotten much better since i last remember the dough is way lighter so you can actually enjoy the whole thing without becoming overly full their naan is always good its soft and warm and i love getting the garlic variety every meal comes with papadum thin baked bread crisp and a few condiments of tamarind sauce onions and a cilantro sauce i love their curries both phaal and vindaloo are my favourites and i usually pick either lamb goat or shrimp as my protein theyre extremely spicy but an order of raita will help cool it down the biriyani is top notch as is their tandoori chicken unbelievably juicy if youre feeling adventurous try some of their hot pickle condiment which is basically spicy pickled lime just writing about it makes my mouth water i would suggest that you take advantage of their buffet if you havent visited before so you get the opportunity to try a variety of items weekdays are less crowded bit get there early because there tends to be a steady flow of people throughout their lunch rush also make sure to fill out a comment card so that you stay alert with their events and specials

boba guys taking over the usa one shop at a timei cant say enough great things about boba guys i remember when i first ventured into one of their sf shops last year i knew the east coast could use some boba improvement months later im happily sipping on their amazing drinks right in the heart of new yorkive pretty much sampled every item on their menu and my alltime favorite is definitely their coffee milk tea a balanced combination of smokey coffee and fragrant black tea its the perfect afternoon drink please make it a permanent item on the menumy other favorites include the jasmine milk tea and the thai milk tea i hate it when boba shops use too much milk powder because it makes the drink taste chalky because boba guys uses real milk it really allows the tea flavors to blossom making it more refreshing as a wholetheir boba is one of the best kept secrets soaking in a mysterious mixture of brown sugar and honey among other unknown ingredients its the perfect qq consistency if youre not a fan of firmer balls be warned that these boba balls will bounce back with every bite but in the most fun delicate cute waycant wait to see the boba guys brand grow in the city

i love this bara buddy of mine recently invited me to the tippler for his birthday considering i frequent the west village i was surprised i hadnt heard of it little did i know its a bit of an underground gem aka a speakeasy bitch sorry i didnt mean to call you thatanyway the tippler is underneath the chelsea market and its quite large like really large whats interesting about the tippler is you could easily miss it the entrance is inconspicuous duh its a speakeasy bro and once inside you have to go down two sets of stairs to get to the barthe inside is great its on the darker side but the low key lighting rugs and optional tables on the side give it a really chill almost apartment like vibe despite the fact that its so large obviously the size of this joint is a huge bonus because ive never gone and felt uncomfortably crowded and theres always somewhere you can escape if you want to have a more intimate conversation with friends or if youre trying to woo a lovely lady or in my case getting horribly rejectedthe drinks are a tad pricey its the west village after all but they are fantastic unique and tasty personally im like a chick when it comes to drinks and i often find myself annoyed that drinks are over poured with booze as opposed to well crafted thankfully the tippler makes strong delicious cocktails for example i love the derek smallsit consists of zubrówka bison grass vodka cucumber grapefruit anise mint i dont know what the hell bison grass vodka even means but i do know this drink basically tastes like an alcoholic green smoothie and you better believe the chick in me was loving this drinklastly and although insignificant to my friends i love love love yes three loves no shame people that the tippler offers self serve spa water infused with lime cucumber or something spa like after a heavy night of drinking this was so clutch as i progressively drank water throughout the night and woke up the next day sans a hangover not to mention it provided fodder for a series of jokes like alright bro hit me with one more for the road but thats the last one as we pretended to be grizzled truckers taking shots of water clearly my friends and i are a cool bunchone thing i would keep in mind with the tippler is theres something depressing about how dark and underground it is now i say that having come to the tippler in the middle of the summer and summertime in ny is all about outdoor drinking so i think this is the absolutely perfect winter bar and ill will undoubtedly be frequenting this place come the colder weatherfinal note i left my credit card at the tippler for over two weeks due purely to laziness when i reached out not only were they friendly and accommodating but they had taken good care of the ol girl the ol girl being my credit card of stars all around for tippler and once winter comes a bar that will be apart of my consistent rotation

this is one of those places that i have bookmarked for when i accidentally stumble upon a pile of unclaimed cah money that mysteriously regrows itself its archived for some future utopia where first world issues like health insurance prudent retirement planning and alzheimers dont exist because zzs is nothing but pure indulgence and possibly the greatest threat to your financial bottom line since obamacarelike many before me my mind was blown from beginning to end throughout the threehour rendezvous with zz the drinks menu is overwhelming only because the options all look equally enticing after some deliberation i went with the buddha because who could resist magical potion in a buddha belly i cant even remember what was in it only that it put me in a deep state of bliss several heavenly uni toasts scallops and yellowtails later i was drunk with love i recalled the fledgling days of my youth the nascent buds of young love the first time i laid naked eyes on my untamed childmanlover gliding over the sinusoidal waves of his ginger peaks and valleys and then the grandmother of all dishes layers upon layers of chianina beef carpaccio spread generously interspersed with sea urchin and topped with caviar the carpaccio yielded to my tongue without resistance the sea urchin was as delicate as a lovers touch and the caviar a product of their love the holy trinity of sea treasures together in one place an explosion of culinary chemistry i let myself succumb to it willingly casting away all my worldly worries to be simply and utterly awash in this sea of joyrising cost of tuition looming water crisis such trivialities pick up all the litter from your humdrum life and stuff it in the back of your closet put on your best suit and head to zzs because sometimes unchecked indulgence is just what you need
oh my goodness gracious i was going to not write a review at first because i assumed all ethiopian restaurants in ny were about this level amazing but after a recent bad dining experience elsewhere ive decided to give injera the great review it deserves because it is my favorite ethiopian restaurant in the city the ambiance here is so cute and romantic the service is amazing they are so friendly and take the time to explain each dish and make sure that you have everything you need but i know you guys just care about the food so let me get to that the yetimatim fitfit diced tomato red onion tomatoes avocado green chilies pieces of injera with olive oil lemon dressing has been the best ethiopian appetizer ive ever had its such a great take on the usual ethiopian salad my roommate and i had the vegetarian combination for two and we were in heaven usually the vegetarian dishes at other ethiopian restaurants arent so flavorful but this was the most flavorfilled dish ive had in a long time i dont know why anyone would complain about small portions i eat like a truck and even i was like rolling out the door by the end of dinner i didnt even have room for ice cream which is unheard of anyways i highly suggest anyone who loves flavor and spices to go go go to injera

midafternoon we were the only customers there after scoping out the inside i went to see what they had on tap and met the bartender and part owner aisa class act as my adoring yelp fans are well aware when deciding where to eat tonight with friends this restaurant name resonated with us so we decided to give it a try we arrived around on a saturday night they dont take reservations for parties smaller than six so we were expecting a wait surprisingly we were seated pretty quickly to minute wait at most the restaurant is small and bustling the dining room is decorated simply with an impressive bar upon entry and a huge golden pizza oven in the back we decided to share everything we started with the beets which came with pickled red onion pistachios and ricotta salata and the kale which came with garlic chili flakes and ricotta salata both were great but i especially liked the kale it was seasoned well and i was in heaven with those bulbs of roasted garlic we then shared the gemelli pasta which was served in a pesto sauce and topped with stracciatella cheese the pasta was good it was cooked al dente and the stracciatella was a nice touch we couldnt leave without trying the pizza so we decided to split two of them as the name of the restaurant suggests the pizzas are wood fired theyre meant to be individualsized and have a rustic look to them with charred edges and an overall irregular shape we went with the goat cheese and the j sexton both were great the flavors worked well with each other and the woodfiring technique really showed service was awesome everyone from the hostess who greeted us to chef chas anderson himself did a really great job super impressed i had a great experience overall definitely a place i would return

you goodsized glasses so dont get too overzealous or you will get blackout i cant see how you wouldnt when we asked the bartender about the full flight he said well its possible but the two of us wanted to find our way home that night so we did the responsible thingfirst things first youll get a paper and pencil to list your choices they were actually out of a few beers we had listed but fortunately that meant that a number of beers on their coming soon list was comingright then and there so voila more beers to choose from if there werent enough already they give you your flight based on the order of the beers youve chosen im not sure if all racks are circular im guessing they are but youre encouraged to go clockwise the first beer you pick will be at oclock i mean technically you can make it whatever o clock you want but you get the point and then you just rotate around simple enough if youre with someone whos as interested in broadening their craft beer horizons as you are id highly recommend this option theyve got such an impressive draft list and for someone whos addicted to trying new things the flight option is really the only option

i hardly do any yoga any more in fact i have skipped yoga for several years now truth be told i have barely been working out lately so it was with considerable skepticism that i signed up for a class at lyons den a brisk fiveminute eastward walk from where i livethe venue has had some interesting uses for it previously but the makeover to being a yoga studio is impressive it has a very east village vibe to itcasual and invitingbut a distinct tribeca feel when you factor in the loftier setting and the older crowd relative to the college kids flocking along st marks placethe ownersbethany and johnare very friendly and engaging bethany seems to be a unique talent who is motivating mindfully merciless with the intensity of the flow and has great command over what goes on in her class the other instructors seem very effective as wellannie meg and brooke to name a few the power flow yoga classes operate at a brisk pace and are sure to leave you sweating and well exercised is lyons den at an early stage of its evolution and growth when everything is brandnew and everyone is friendly and accessible i sure hope not while i cant see how the business could grow in its current location i suspect new locations could spring up over time hopefully not at the expense of diluting bethanys and the other teachers commitment to this tribeca gem

this is review i had saved it for a special place and mŏkbar fits that billthey say true geniusoften strikes in the pale moments between awake and asleep i must have been sleepwalking all these years because i havent truly had koreanstyle ramen until today and the experience i had by definition was a culinary eyeopener this brings us to why we feel mŏkbar is deserving of the brainchild of njnative esther choi began operating in chelsea market in may of billed as the first koreanstyle ramen in the city theyre situated across from los tacos which im not a fan of you can read my review on that riding on a wave of high acclaim from media outlets esthers food network appearance on beat bobby flay aired sept in case youre interested catapulted the restaurant into the cross hairs of the masses for better or worse having cut her teeth with experience at ilili and la esquina also helped hone her craft from training at institute of culinary education icewhen i first visited one afternoon months earlier i had the classic ramen my mistake it didnt set my palate on fire i returned to rectify this on a thursday chelsea gallery opening night ordering dishes until i bursted with fruitflavorfoodfor small plates or as it should be called anju we ordered hocakes japchae dumplings tteokbokki and spicy mok wings anju is typically accompanied by alcohol so we simply had to have the soju sampler where each glass come flavored by a different fruit or inspiration sorry i cant remember them all the hocakes otherwise known as hotteok are every bit as amazing as ive heard about these savory stuffed pancakes of pork every morsel with satisfying chew it was probably not meant to be shared because it will fall apart if you try to cut into one of the halves hahaha the japchae dumplings although true to the dish that it draws inspiration from i prefer my japchae served up on a plate not so much in the form of a dumpling just my preference however the dumpling had a nice crisp to them and the glass noodles danced around inside my mouth with the accompanying sauce being spoton the tteokbokki was a nice surprise because ive made them at home with gochujang and so i know that the rice cakes are typically huge logs with satisfying chew their take is a fantastic departure in that theyre the size of penne with crisp chew and heat all in the same bite this would ideally go great with beer in any case they were still crispy even while marinating in the sauces impressive finally the mok wings which we ordered spicy were marinated in gochujang the right amount of kick without overpowering the flavor of the wings simply fun to eat much like the tteokbokkifor my entree i ordered the kimchi ramen along with porkbelly and extra noodles because you can never have enough i enjoy these soups thatre served hot and also packing sufficient heat despite the summer months the presentation is all there sun noodles as everpresent in commercially produced ramen is also nice to see the porky soup broth provides the requisite kick and flavor from the kimchi as expected the cabbage itself provides all the veggies id like to eat for the night allinall i love it without the egg definitely onpar with all the ramen heavyhitters in the cityserviceservice is as quick and attentive as youd expect from a standalone restaurant making sure your table never runs out of water getting small plates to the table first getting entrees out altogether checking on your experience basically all the little things which always ends up mattering so muchetcvegan ramen is offered and this means misobased this is huge a restaurant offering a menu set of this size is remarkable considering the spacekitchen they have to work with they have seating by the kitchen counter and in the back away from the prying eyes and those seatvultures in chelsea market yes like you i am one too the only drawback i find with mŏkbar is that its set within the busy energy that is chelsea market amidst the hustle and bustle of shoppers stragglers lunchgoers foodies ive heard my fair share of ignoramus commentary while waiting a few minutes for my table like what kind of chinese is this and so i also dont especially welcome the prying eyes burning into the back of my skull nor the onlookers with the look of bemusement gazing at the bizarre foods that im savoringsummarymŏkbar is a solid casual dining option among various noncompeting choices in chelsea market catering to both tourists and workerbees alike from around the area eg google the only korean eatery within the chelseamepa districts offering ramen and gastropub anju fare i can see esther take the mŏkbar concept into its own standalone restaurant as it truly deserve a home to call its own
lawrence and david are my shit alyssa kills it too katharine is great and so is siobhanthis yoga studio was hard for me to find i visited at least five other studios in my search of the one my journey ended when i found modo hot sweaty classes with great facilities and conscious teachers its a beautiful thingstart off with the traditional modo class if your even somewhat new to yoga and especially to modo even if its just one take it and get comfortable with it its always the same postures every single class so you know what to expect they have different time lengths and next try modo flow similar to modo in that its the same postures every class but its more challenging you get in numerous chatarungas and its very similar to a typical vinyasa flow but always consistent again they offer different lengths of time in the classesthen grab a freestyle flow vinyasa class with ever changing postures and sometimes depending on what it says on the schedule they have music playing in the background these teachers dont mess aroundcome ready to sweat and flowthen my favoriteyin yang get your flow on for the first half of class think freestyle flow then slow it down and get into the yin portion you will walk in there thinking its not that hot and that you absolutely will not be sweaty and then just wait this class will kick your butt and stretch you out in the most delicious ways lawrence is my favorite teacher for this style of class they offer minute versions but try the minute it doesnt get any better reallyone other thing that reeeally turned me on to modo is the locker rooms clean showers but best of all lockers that lock out of all the ny studios i visited before modo none had lockers i could lock ive had my debit card and id stolen at a studio before so thats a huge priority to me just because were all looking for enlightenment doesnt mean someone wont snatch up your purse duringafter class

you get at your local supermarket drug store convenience store midtier dept stores etc however prices can be steep on items but quality over quantity as your kiehls items tend to last longer bc you dont need to use of tons of it to see feel the benefits at work as opposed to cheaper products which need to be slathered on multiple timespackaging is simple either black on white or a simple primary color much like the store itself or the ingredients list of the merchkiehls employs the less is more by using high quality over quantity and it stands behind this by its generous sampling policy from i love dim sumbuddha bodai is an excellent choice for gettogethers whether its an intimate dinner or brunch with a group of friends as they offer an array of chinese dishes that is sure to please omnivores and vegans alike the dim sum offered throughout the week till pm is served hk style which ensures that each dish is freshly made and not sitting around all day unlike the carts in other dim sum establishments their vegan spare ribs which has a firm texture and sweet marinade taste even better than what you would get at a nonvegan restaurant the crullers wrapped with rice paper are quite addicting the steamed veggie dumplings were also very good as per the regular menu i had the mushroom and bok choy with black pepper sauce the sauce was light and the dish was a large portion enough to share between two peopleim definitely a fan of the buddha i think if you give them a try you would be toohappy eats

we were so pleasantly surprised by izakaya due to a poorlyplanned sunday evening nap time we ended up dinnerless at pm our usual goto was closed so we turned to yelp for suggestions stars is a good sign anywhere so we came here its an unassuming little holeinthewall near alphabet city sunken into a small stretch of lane peppered with other small foodie joints to be honest we expected to eat well but nothing fancy the photocopied menu doesnt say much about the amazing fare available youre best off asking the waitstaff for their top recommendation or what people order the most often their obvious enthusiasm and intimate familiarity with the menu was very refreshing and got us very excited about our foodwe had the cold tofu the beef sashimi the omelet and the chicken nanban as well as the kagua blanc beer we were the only ones in the restaurant so everything came out at the perfect pace not too quick not too slow the tofu is dryaged for two days so it has a custardy texture the aging process allows the whey to naturally drain out they top it with a sharpflavored leafy garnish in addition to fresh scallions with homemade dashi soy sauce mmm the dashi was a little bit salty but it helped with the creamy tofu texture i just dipped sparingly no big deal as the waiter passionately explained the raw beef washu i believe is a hybrid between kobe and angus cattle for a mediummarbled fatty texture that isnt too heavy afterward it was scrumptious and didnt even require any of the dipping sauce to taste delicious i wrapped mine around some of the green scallions and left out the wasabi to enjoy the full beef flavor on my tongue mmm the chicken nanban was the juiciest bite of fried goodness ive ever had it tastes like the chicken is marinated in the same salad dressing it comes with and then lightly battered and fried the ranchytartare sauce was a little overwhelming for my personal taste but you can easily scrape off any excess if you so choose the salad was very fresh and light the perfect complement to the chicken as for the kagua beer it was very light with some unique piquant notes to it my beer palate isnt very refined so i cant tell you from taste how it stood out ill just rely on the waiters description of it being a japaneseflavored beer made in belgium that sold out in japan in two weeks special water used for the brewing process and some special japanese ingredients i believe yuzu citrus and a japanese chili pepper delicious and well worth the the little details like very highquality disposable chopsticks are what make this place a fivestar experience again very pleasantly impressed my expectations werent high based on appearances
one of the most iconic and famous museums in manhattan the met has something for everyone for you gossip girl lovers sit on the steps of the entrance to live out your serena blair moment you can also get in for a suggested donation most recently i came to the met to see the china through the looking glass exhibit i really enjoyed it and it was one of the most talked about exhibits since mcqueens which the fashionista in me very much enjoyed im glad i made it there after work before the exhibit ended and it wasnt too crowded at nightif fashion isnt quite your thing then there are plenty of sections for you to check out about ancient cultures there are also various events throughout the year that are worth checking out so keep your calendar updated this is by far one of my favorite museums in manhattan and i enjoy coming here a few times a year
snowdays is a heavenly place for shaved icesnow lovers i went gaga over the myriad yummy toppings i decided to be totally unoriginal and go with made in taiwan which im sure every other asian girl orders it had everything i wantedmatcha snow mochi grass jelly condensed milkeverything except red beans so for cents i added the red bean topping and it was bomb i love the matcha flavor it was not too sweet and had that familiar grassy taste i love but it wasnt overwhelming maybe just maybe if i scrutinize the flavor it could be a little less sweet i felt a sticky sweet aftertaste in my mouth but that could be from the condensed milk overall great flavorfor the uninitiated the made in taiwan combo is very traditional taiwanesejapanese once you try it you will know exactly why matcha mochi grass jelly condensed milk and red bean always go hand in hand they also have a variety of interesting flavors like yeti tracks and you can be like a kid and add fun things to your snow like pocky sticks rainbow sprinkles peanut butter sauce etc etc
i was really surprised to find such a high quality tea shop a couple streets down from columbia i just moved here and was frantically yelping bubble teaboba places near campus since im used to having near me at all times in california although culture tea bar was highly rated it didnt seem like as many people knew about it or went there this made me question how good it really was but i decided to give it a try what a treati ordered an iced osmanthus oolong milk tea with less sugar and though it was slightly sweeter than i would have preferred the tea flavor was distinct and fragrant i was very impressed to learn that they brew each tea to order with looseleaf tea leaves using a tea brewing machine that looks similar to an espresso maker it was refreshing to see that they had actual tea variations like fuji apple black tea cherry blossom green tea and blended black tea rather than flavors caramel taro etc that rely heavily on powders and syrupsthey do take credit card but remember that theres a minimum since theres wifi and some limited seating it would be a nice place for studying when its not too crowded however the tiny space can get quite cramped so id recommend getting a drink togo will definitely be returning

tanoshi has long been on my list of omakase places to try despite all of the good things that have been said about it and the high grade fish the restaurant itself is unassuming and low key the sushi bar seats people and there are three sushi chefs one for each corner of the bar this was on the side we were on they have storefronts the omakase is per person and it includes pieces of nigiri one handroll and small sushi rolls while the omakase itself may be reasonably priced there are a lot of items available for a la carte that can rack up your bill there are two lists on the wall of the appetizers and the add on pieces and a hand drawn map of where all the fish is sourced from we ordered the chawanmushi the ikura uni and ankimo the chawanmushi was delectable the texture was silky smooth and there were pieces of chicken shrimp and peas inside the ikura uni was basically a sandwich composed of salmon squid and uni and boy was it a generous helping in fact i think there were more parts of uni than salmon the ankimo or monk fish liver is a must have the texture can take some getting used to but it is definitely one of my favorites the omakase began with fluke the fluke was delicately sliced with an interwoven technique and it was the perfect size next we had the alaskan king salmon seared in propane for a few seconds salmon is one of my favorites so this was very enjoyable one of the more exciting pieces was the amber jack fish topped with a cherry blossom leaf the leaf was edible and extremely fragrant i also really enjoyed the firefly squid something ive never tried before while the rest of the pieces were delicious i think its important to discuss the add ons the normal sea urchin that tanoshi uses is from maine it is absolutely satisfying but for sea urchin connoisseurs you will want to order the japanese uni which is from hokkaido another must try piece is the triple x salmon roe sea urchin and quail egg this piece is absolutely exquisite my friend tried the ice fish this is poached which we did not know beforehand there was a novelty about this but we probably wouldnt order this again instead i would have tried the crab brain shout out to geronimo who really made our meal we talked to him throughout our meal and he was very knowledgeable about all the pieces

branch admittedly i would hate to reveal too much it is a spot to check out though if you want quality service and very well made drinks a lowkey sexy yet simultaneously casual atmosphere i will say who should open the door promptly it is firstcome firstserve basis so obviously you will want to come earlier than later if you want to avoid the wait not a very large place but accommodates just the right amount of people for a good nights crowd without being obnoxious i love the red walls and the dark intimate and super cozy atmosphere it creates two bartenders man the tiny bar at the front but this tiny bar has a lot to offer what is great is the breakdown of their menu which displays yet to be classified recently classified to from the archives under these categories is the classification of lethal and lively lethal is of course the stronger of the cocktails lively is the refreshinglighter ones i started off with a lethal red orchestra gin kumaru maraschino cherry brandy and celery bitters this was an excellent stiff cocktail yet not peaty and smooth to the last drop second drink was the classic yet lethal martinez from the archives old tom gin sweet vermouth maraschino bokers and orange bitters again while it was a lethal martini it was very tasty and easy to take down with each sip service was excellent too as one of the bartendersservers was very helpful in providing input i will definitely be returning to dead drop soon bring a friend or two a date and you should not be disappointed do not be shy going for the lethal cocktails either they are all tasty and will be worth it in the end

freemans was one of the first and most memorable places i visited in nyc right before moving there a couple months later i was looking for a place to have brunch with my family for my birthday and was drawn to this place in particular because of the lovely rustic decor and the fact that it was hidden and off the beaten path i will never forget turning a corner and walking down that very unassuming urban alley that leads to a tiny rustic entryway one minute i was in new york and the next i was somewhere much more remote the interior is stunning i am a sucker for atmosphere and this place really did a great job in that department there is lot of warmth wood flora and taxidermy its simple rustic and reminiscent of an old world hunting lodge or farm house the menu is great and offers a nice variety of simple hearty american fare downstairs was a little more tightly packed but we were seated upstairs which was less busy and had more room to spread out since we were a larger group the food was fantastic and everyone enjoyed their meal adults and kids alike the brunch cocktails were great as well and the prices were very reasonable ive returned one other time just for drinks downstairs unfortunately that time the service was not very good because our bartender was not very nice but i wont hold that against them since my last experience was excellent all around i would recommend freemans for a variety of occasions its great for brunch with friends but at night i would imagine it is super romantic and therefore would probably make for a great date night spot i cant wait to come back for dinner

i recently took advantage of the opportunity to see one world observatory prior to its actual opening i was excited from the second i chose my tour time everything here is very organized the entrance is separate from the employee entrance which is smart and there is staff everywhere to help you along the way i promise you cannot and will not get lost once youre inside you go down the escalator they check your ticket and you go through tsatype security be prepared to take off your belts and empty your pocketsonce youre through security you wait for the elevator that everyone has been talking about its no joke you get to the floor in a matter of seconds and on the way up you see the city being built from farmland to what it is today your ears will also pop at the end the floor has a small theater where you watch a quick visual of ny today and there is a little surprise at the end i wont give that away you eventually make your way down to the floor which has views meaning you can see the city brooklyn staten island lady liberty etc etc tons of photo ops on all the floors even though it was overcast when we went you could still see pretty far outthere is also the sky portal which you can walk on it looks like you could fall through at any moment so its a bit of a mind fck but its awesome nonetheless there is also a restaurant and a gift shop which i disagree with but whatever if you want to see a beautiful building and experience pretty much all of nyc you should definitely come here once it opens on may also the video in the elevators going down is totally different and if you typically experience motion sickness this might not be for you overall a fantastic way to spend an hour or two
