im here every other week i am a museum person and let me tell you something no other museum in the world compares to thiseverything is organized chronologically everything is organized neatly and symmetrically everything is taken care of with utter diligence there is a department for everything even for lighting this is my favorite place in the world go up the grand stairs make sure to dont miss out on the egyptian and roman wings look at the wonderful van gogh paintings they are thoughtfully placed with the gauguin ones enjoy the picassos and the monets too dont ignore the period rooms make sure to visit the american wing but dont ignore the tiffany fountain or the tiffany arches take it all in theres something for everybody it is a public museum for those who didnt know you can request to see a piece of art they have in storage and they will show it to you it is also suggested donation put always add a buck or two from what you were initially planning to give it takes a lot to keep such an institution running have you ever seen a da vinci sketch up close the museum will be open late until they say on friday and saturday but they will start closing the galleries and guiding people out earlier so lets call it there will be live music and the great hall bar will be open they have a good selection of wine and cocktails they offer wine flights for the rooftop bar is open but its a weird ambiance with the fake grass and overpriced meh drinks the views are great
summary siggys is a terrific spot for comfort food with gourmet flare smoothies and juices and a menu that offers something for everyone but thatll make vegans and vegetarians especially happy if youve been to siggys original brooklyn location the menu here mostly overlaps with the one there but the space here is maybe two or three times bigger and more stylish though the original location is cozy and a swell space to eat in the new siggys feels more refined somehow more like a restaurant you could come here with friends or family but itd work for casual dates too all the produce used is organic and maybe more importantly all the meat is sourced well eg the beef is pastured infinite plus pointsmisc details the macaroni n cheese is excellent the whole wheat pasta has more body and feels more substantial than plain pasta and the cream cheese sauce turns your mouth into a gooey wonderland my friends and i split this four ways and had it as an appetizer the soupblackeyed peas tomatoes and celerywas equally great its a daily special but if you like hearty vegetable soups and this is available youll like this salmon burger w feta on briochesolid they were two sizeable patties side by side and they paired well with the feta smeared onto the toasted bun i liked this but i hear the turkey burger here is phenomenal and the beef burger is all pasturedbeef as is all the beef served here and i was left wishing id maybe tried one of those the raspberry tart as with the bk location this is the best dessert its crispy tart sweet and leaves you impressed that its vegan its not huge but big enough to split two ways easy or even three or four ways if you want more of an amusebouchey dessert siggys has a small selection of organic beersthe pinkus wheat lager is sweeter than most beers but if youre okay with that its a very good hefeweizen its also the sort of place that has themeappropriate political flyers up in the bathrooms did you know that monsanto is suing vermont because vermont passed a law mandating all gmo foods be labeled as such i did not know this but i do now now you might not worry about genetics and crops reasoning that its silly to worry about any such thing when were all doomed anyway what with the seas rising and the advent of the ai overlords nearly upon us so you might just go to siggys to enjoy wholesome food before that happens and thats okay the politics dont get in the way of the eating

perfect for large parties i reserved the semiprivate room in the back that can hold up to people max when people ended up coming the room obviously became super cramped so many ventured out into the main bar space which was totally fine if i were to do this again with the same number of people i would reserve the additional tables right next to the semiprivate room the best part about the winslow was the excellent service unlike similar lounges like stanton social or verlaines the winslow is one of the few if not only slightly higherend manhattan bars that do not require an initial deposit a crazy minimum charge and one or limited tabs for parties they also offer open bar specials but i decided to go with the easier cashcredit bar keiran one of the managers was so nice and easy to work easygoing that they let me rearrange the furniture in the semiprivate space rory was sweet and friendly and all my friends were happy with how quickly he came back with our drink orders especially when he was our only server throughout the night both kieran and rory made sure to ask me how my friends and i were doing the food here is delicious i ordered several party platters which you order landed in la around and made its way to nyc in spicebox opened on pell st in the heart of chinatown in october so theyre still relatively new to the neighborhood they have reportedly locations including in guangzhou china in guangdong china and this new nyc outpostone cant help but draw comparisons to other japanesestyle crêperies eight turn tswirl little known big bear and traditional french crêperies the timely conical shape preparation while not all that difficult to execute is still an art and thus difficult to master savory or sweet theres sure to be something for everyone either for breakfast lunch or snack to be shared made to order onpremises the price point is comparably in the rangei ordered the tokyo in a bite strawberries red bean green tea ice cream pocky sticks yogurt chocolate sauce which was easily my favorite of the whole menu and piece of new york blueberries cheesecake jam whipped yogurt house nutella and while these are different in their own right theyre just as tasty and fresh as their counterparts theyre named after theyre light flavorful and portable with their own handheld tear off cardboard container to consume it in the ingredients are fresh and complement each other well within the crêpeive also ordered a cappuccino or two and know that they offer a perfectly acceptable blend of standard coffee this is actually a great place for me to duck into to get my caffeine fix while everyone else queues up at the other cafes by the way the cup and matching polar bear sleeve are ridiculously adorablethe space is fun and inviting with colorful adornments throughout and detailed hexagonal floortiling a chalkboard menu keeps the menu dynamic and the wall of crêpes adorning the window is a nod to the japanese fake food motifid like to see if they add to the menu as the weather gets warmer parfait and frozen yogurt sound good to me but hopefully something unique original and insanely instagramworthyspicebox may be an underdog in this space but theyre the ones to watch as i expect they may be adding delivery and catering options to weather the seasonality of their product and target small businesses too as i dont enjoy venturing into neighboring nolita their location within chinatown is perfect for me and ought to help them capitalize on tourist and local traffic overall rating
woke up one morning and felt like my right ear was stuffed and could not hear so well no other symptoms being your above average neurotic i went to google and read about sudden sensorineural hearing loss basically sudden deafness that comes out of the blue then spent an hour watching youtube clips of doctors removing bugs and other unpleasant things from ears after a day or so with no change i decided that i should probably seek the help of an ent went to castle connolly see my yelp review and started calling doctors luckily i was able to get an appointment with dr rothstein the next day he accepts many different types of insurance after booking the appointment i starting reading patient reviews and was happy to see that they were practically all glowing i thought to myself what are the chances of being able to get a next day appointment with a cc listed doc who accepts my insurance and has universally excellent reviewswent to see the doc the next day great modernclean office located at the nyu langone medical center turned out no bugs just a little impacted wax that he gently removed no pain at all i will be the first to admit im a bit of a doctor snob stellar credentials and a decent bedside manner mean a lot to me i also like to see doctors that have been practicing medicine for a long time but not too long dr rothstein exceeded my expectations in every respect not only does he have a good professional reputation he is a heimishe guy who made me feel very much at ease i highly recommend him if you are in need of an entps the entire consultation i was thinking of this scene youtubedwswnutvsmipps it is a great feeling to be able to hear perfectly out of both my ears again this whole incident has made me appreciate and marvel at how our ears work

aire ancient bathsi am so thrilled i stumbled upon this place upon first walking in we thought wow we are out of our element the fancy lighting and interior design was beautiful but much more than we are used to we checkedin and were given wrist bands that magically opens a locker lockers hold a bathrobe towel and slippers so all you need is your bathing suit what stood out immediately was how friendly helpful and welcoming the staff was there were women working in the locker room making sure we all knew what to do and they brought us down to the pools when we were ready we thought it would be relatively empty as our time slot was pm on a tuesday night but it was fulloh my dear lordthe pools a salt water pool a very hot pool degrees a freezing cold pool with ice chunks degrees a jet whirl pool a pool in back that we called the grotto because it was hidden and dark and cavelike and then the steam room the most incredible steam room ive ever encountered enclosed in a glass room with aromatherapywe tried each pool quickly to figure out which we liked best and then we had two hours to relax float and breathe deeply yes as others have said most people here are couples and people did seem to get very touchy feely which might make some uncomfortable i just ignored them and enjoyed myself we had also booked minute massages which were wonderful and much too short although im glad because that gave us more time to spend in the wonderful pools massage time is included in your twohour time slotthis is the perfect romantic date or special occasion celebration it is very expensive so its perfect for a treat i had the best time and would recommend it to everyone i know book far in advance as they get quite busy
in parerga und paralipomena arthur schopenhauer relates a parable of porcupines huddling together in winter for warmth inevitably pricking each other in the process after several instances of this the porcupines finally settle on a distance wherein their collective heat remains a resource albeit less than ideally but without the fear of being jabbed by one anothers quills this behavioral framework eventually became known as the hedgehogs dilemma and a quote within the parable came to be known as an early reference to mans tendency toward isolationism a man who has some heat in himself prefers to remain outside where he will neither prick other people nor get pricked himselfrebelle and pearl ash are sister restaurants and on first glance at least should by the above parable be inextricably intertwined in their respective bloodstained quills yet somehow in a separation of but a few feet and while sharing a theme the two restaurants remain distinct and each serves to strengthen the other rebelle on its conceptual surface is the sort of inchoate culinary rebellion that entices talented chefs who tire of classical haute cuisine it is not a renouncement of necessary skill but rather a recognition of the creative possibility and risk of a greater degree of freedom serious food in a more casual setting while some may roll their eyes at the idea of yet another per se expat using moderately larger tweezers to arrange moderately smaller plates that isnt the sort of apostasy rebelle incites or contributes to rebelle is instead the closest place to a new wave parisian bistro outside of well paris bistros in paris have gradually come to be reclaimed by a young generation of prodigious talents seeking to deal less in faste and more in fantasque the man chosen to head the kitchen of rebelle daniel eddy formerly the chef at spring in paris was unsurprisingly a figure of that movement it should come as no shock then that a good number of the dishes are cleverly altered renditions of french culinary history and technique beets bourguignon retain the earthy savoriness of the requisite mushrooms and subtle sweetness of the equally obligatory carrots but treads on an altogether lighter plane and rather than mentally prepare you for a long winter it leaves you contemplating the approaching luminance of summer in a nod to the almost fanatical precondition of acceptance of a bistros quality the pork headcheese is a showcase in charcuterie skills of the desserts not ordering the cherry clafoutis would be a mistake yes theyre done by a per se expat no you shouldnt roll your eyeswine much as at pearl ash is unimpeachable as should be expected the list at rebelle skews slightly more french than its predecessor in keeping with the theme that said the sheer breadth of obscurity affordability and amazing finds french or otherwise leave the list at either restaurant as unparalleled in the city the by the glass offerings are reasonably priced and serve as a suitable lens through which to view the list often featuring wines that dont normally see that sort of exposure the sommeliers are much more wellversed in the page tome than is reasonable and like patrick himself are more invested in leading you to what you want to drink than in pushing trends rebelle like its sister before it is the epitome of what small plates restaurants were envisioned capable of cool exciting satisfying and most of all damned good fun vive la résistance

should be here for a good few hours trying a little bit of every thing they offer the buffet consists of but is not limited to a raw bar sushi bar a meat carving station charcuterie of cheese and officially stuffed by note take your time no one will rush you soak in as much of the experience and try as much of their food you might not get this chance too oftenrainbow room is a truly landmark classy establishment with much to offer when it comes to dining and atmosphere do not neglect to dress to impress hardly pretentious at all as some may think all in all superb time at the rainbow room i would undoubtedly return and recommend others to try
voilà is to chocolate what yankee stadium is to baseball the best chocolate comes here to be tempered and transformed in many cases with your help as part of an experience that is both unique and educationalvoilà is premium on all frontsthe venue is contemporary and features modern furniture the chefs are wellpedigreed and know their chocolate and the ingredients and utensils are all sourced with care the brain behind voilà is peter who not playfully has anointed himself with the title of chief cocoa nutyou can choose to make chocolate bark truffles lollipops or bars the chefs will adeptly guide you through the process and help package the end product i duly consumed the two boxes of chocolate bark i made the last time i visited voilà alternatively you can simply buy their premade chocolate or visit the store to try their hot chocolate voilà also hosts corporate events one cautionary notetry not to make nicerlooking chocolate than your bossdo not miss this retail concept if you are visiting the upper west side or if you live within a radius of voilà

ive been to scarpetta at least times during the last couple of years and while i have certainly eaten at more inventive restaurants i am compelled to give it stars largely due to its consistency and the fact that i find myself back here time and time again i have come here on a date with friends and with out of towners and parents reservations are not hard to come by if you are flexible with a or seating and the location is in an easily accessible part of townfirst off the bread is not something to gloss over here while at other places bread almost seems like a formality at scarpetta bread is the first course their famed complimentary stromboli is served warm and with generous chunks of salami and mozzarella i do not remember a single time when i did not ask for seconds and i admit i have gone to scarpetta with precisely the intent of showing my dining companions how great it isappetizers are solid as well but if you are getting just one then it would have to be the polenta it is unbelievably creamy and the mushrooms add a great flavor to the dish scallops are seared well but expensive at for two small ones and you are better off getting the braised short ribs scott conant is most famed for his simple spaghetti dish which i tried on my first visit but not again not to say it wasnt good but i prefer the richness of the duck and foie gras ravioli or the sweetness of the short rib and bone marrow agnolotti my boyfriend and i took my mom and her friend here two weeks ago so we shared several pasta dishes which i thought was the perfect way to try a bit of everything the foie gras ravioli in particular was well received by everyonemains are less exciting than the pastas but the prime sirloin of beef is done very well and a good one to share the black cod is not to be missed eitherif youve left room for dessert the ganache bar and warm banana bread are both personal favorites service is attentive without being intrusive and ambiance is beautiful i definitely will be continuing to visit scarpetta in the years to come
i came here last night on a first date to meet up with for coffee sadly she was a little late and i had a chance to speak to the staff heres what i ascertained this wonderful little coffee shop is brand new at only a month or two old they make all their sandwich meats in house which means roasting the roast beef and all the chicken and what not theyre not using some boars head stuff they do it all there so freshness is never an issue the coffeelatteshot chocolates are all amazing i can attest i had the hot chocolate it was probably the best hot chocolate i had in a long timeheres what i noticed this place is a somewhat of a hidden gem with several large tables and a few small ones its good for hanging out for a few hours or just grab and go the tables are large comfortable the smaller tables are for a pair or so its nice and warm inside and pretty comfortable although maybe id like them to have a little more comfortable seating ideally id like to come back bring my laptop do some work and look like a hipster in this coffeesandwich shop i intend to do that in the near future while working on whatever i need to do on my laptop when i have free time and need to get away from my apartment i just wonder how the staff will take it plus i dont know if they have wifi and mind if you sit there and just buy a coffee and hang out
came for brunch and was going to come here again to really decide if i wanted to give it a i thought about it and you know what yeseverything here hit the nail for me price interior food and service add on for bottomless mimosas freshly made pasta for fresh pasta yes it surprised me i found their lunch menu more interesting you could also customize the pasta type we ordered the brussels sprouts wild boar ragu with pappardelle sausage and pepper with garganelli and eggs benedict and of course the bottomless mimosas the brussels sprouts were crispy and the pancetta pecorino and fuji apples paired well i probably could have ate more plates of it next was the wild boar ragu the pappardelle was thinner than other ones i have had but i actually liked it more like this the wild boar also was not gamey at all which was my initial fear when ordering it it was similar to pulled pork in texture and delicious my boyfriend ordered the sausage and pepper pasta which was also good but actually i dont like bell peppers if you really love bell peppers get that dish i did not get to try the eggs benedict but it did look good hahaservice was excellent they were very friendly and made sure to fill up our mimosas like water even after we paid they encouraged us to stay and drink some more awesomethe only downside of this place is the portions arent too big and their dishes are so yummy that you might end up eating two entrees thats how they get you with the nice prices i guess i dont eat too much so it was the perfect amount for me but i can see it being a problem to people with big appetites if anything get more appetizersyay
credit cards acceptedmy roommate and i were literally the first people in the new xian at this morning when they officially opened for business with free noodles were both ecstatic and mortified there goes our diet that this location is so close to home xian noodles every daythis location compared to some of the older locations of xian is huge the downstairs area hosts an open kitchen where you pick up your food and at least counterbar seats to eat this location even has an upstairs eating area complete with natural lighting through skylights ive since learned that this area is closed unless the downstairs has run out of seating theres plenty of space for everyone to enjoy their food and you wont have to hound people while theyre eating to get a seat like the st marks midtown or chinatown locations the ventilation here is also good and you wont smell like food for the rest of the day after eating here also side note this place isnt full of xian propaganda newspaper articles and tv reruns as the other places areas with the other xians my gotos liang pi cold spicy noodles with gluen chunks if you take it to go make sure you ask for the sauce on the spicy and tingly beef noodles in mt qi pork noodle soup diced pork with a sourstar anise soup spicy pork noodles in soupand anything in soup really the nonsoup versions same order number but without the s is good but i always favor noodle soupsthe handpulled watch them make it noodles here are legit and its hard to find this kind of al dente pulled noodle anywhere else in the cityps takeout xian never tastes as good as when you eat it in the restaurant except for the cold noodlescheers to xian this will definitely be my new goto spot when im lazy to cook
hells kitchen is a new mexican restaurant in the hells kitchen midtown manhattan hence the name the mexican sugar skull art theme sets a trendy ambiance throughout the restaurantwe had large frozen margaritas with trio of guacamole to start avocado grilled pineapple and habanero chile and mint flavors served with tri color crispy corn tortillas it was a perfect appetizer to start the dinner withwe shared the quesadilla braised pork with jack and cheddar cheeses cilantro and salsa in homemade flour tortilla we ordered two tacos the braised short ribs with pumpkin seed guacamole and the grilled tuna with romesco sauce and almonds served with homemade corn tortillas with pickled radish garnishesthis place is great with the right choices of background music and good custumer service a bit pricey for what it is but we will definitely come back for a date night
i forgot to write a review for this new location since it first opened a few weeks ago because i cant stop coming here and eating doughnuts any time i am within a mile radius of iti eat a lot of doughnuts i am pretty sure i have tried every doughnut shop in new york after much research these are without a doubt the best in the entire cityafter several stops at their stand at the smorgasburg locations and at their original storefront in bed stuy i have tried all of the many different flavors they still seem to come up with new ones all the time though i most recently discovered the filled nutella doughnut for the first time here and it blew my mind this one and the other filled ones they have are smaller than the regular giant yeast ones but pack even more flavoryou cant go wrong with any of these but the cafe au lait and dulce de leche are up there as the best of the bunch if you love chocolate then you will love my favorite ones the salted chocolate caramel or the mocha with crushed almonds which are so incredibly rich and chocolatey and gooey that you need to take a bath after eating themyou used to have to go line up at smorgasburg or go to the remote shop in bed stuy to get your hands on these beauties but now not only are they available at this much more accessible location but are also showing up in nearly every coffee shop throughout both manhattan and especially brooklyn they always seem a bit fresher from one of the storefront locations but no matter where you get your hands on these theres no denying how incredible they are

with totto ramen right next door no like literally right next door this place has some major competition truthfully i only noticed it because i was going to totto ramen and almost walked into the wrong place i scoffed at the cahones of this place trying to compete with the infamous totto ramen pshh i felt sorry for this little fishas a self diagnosed ramen addict i felt a duty to try hidechan to see how it stacked against the rest despite my allegiance to totto and you know what its now my favorite ramen place in the city first off theres real seating here unlike totto ramen i could have a real conversation with my coworker and didnt spend all my time trying not to fall of a stool ok but in reality those are minor details id eat outside in the cold for a great bowl of ramen so onto the important stuff first off you have the choice of wavy or staight extra firm firm medium or softextra firm wavy spicy ramen with corn totto who i had a new lover and his name was chan hidechan that is the meat was tender the broth was rich the noddles were cooked to perfection the heat was just enough oh and the wooden ladle is just fun to eat with bye totto hello chan

youi let his extra how are you linger in the autumnal air as we step inside the bar the ambiance at bar jamon is what i call eurofresh because im an ugly fatfingered american who lumps all the european countries together it is lively but not uncomfortably packed and service is easy and smooth i like this placewe stand by the wall for no more than a minute waiting for seats to open suddenly an entire bottle of wine falls off its place on the wall and lands beside my plasticshoed datethe bottle shatters bleeds out on the floor wet shards of dark glass blinking up at usa server swoops in and cleans up the gruesome sight with nary a word of blame or disdain eurofresh is the best kind of freshwe are seated at a slim counter and order a responsible aka meagre me amount of wine red as a bodega macintoshpolite conversation is had no one is buzzed just two grownups living the eurofresh lifewe finish our wine and step out into the slightly frenetic fuzz that befalls union square at rushhourbathed in the flattering halo of magic hour we circle the block my highheeled boots syncopating with the flipflap of his polymer slideswhen we talk about this walk in the future i will claim to barely remember it and he will argue that it was the most shocking part of the date according to him without warning or provocation id suddenly turned to him and said wanna see my fake tooth then before he could assert himself and say no i allegedly reached into my mouth and pulled out one of my front teeth glistening with saliva in the setting sun he allegedly recoiled i allegedly smiled proudly like a gaptoothed jackolantern or a grizzled uncle returning from the vietnam warwe circle back to the subway entrance at the bottom of best buy as commuters stream past us like tiny slivers of fish we solemnly recite the usual litany of declarations that conclude first dateswell i better go got class tomorrowthis was fun we should do it againyeahwe shake hands like businessmen and i descend the stairs to the underground train that courses through this city our city bloody unstoppable veinousa few days later he sends me an email with a single attachment a pdf of a new york times article about dental health i do not respond to this strange document productionand we do not see each other again for a long timeautumn degrades into winterfools gather in times square to carry the years disappointments into the next counting down in unison to the slow and steady descent of a crystal ballwinter loosens its grip on our throats and in its place spring summers ugly sisterpastel mannequins cheer on pedestrians as they lean into the rain with black umbrellas shuddering in the windpant hems creep up two precise inchesand slumbering college students awaken to the sound of birdplayit isnt until may that we meet again in a parking garage in midtown eastto be continued in my review of the location of our date
in short in a space along a street in midtown that has undergone many a transformation in its lifetime one can only pray that betony with its michelin star food and service that makes you feel like youre sitting down for a meal in your living room is here to stay for a whilethe story in a world that seems to increasingly seek and embrace the singular superlative title of the best thing i ever ate betony slips quietly into the scene with its purely extraordinary piece of roasted chicken this chicken is undoubtedly the best piece of chicken in new york sliced in a slender triangle and draped with seasonal vegetables like celery root sitting over a decadent jus the chicken is impossibly soft and tender like none i have ever had before managing to occupy a buttery chicken flavor so perfectly fresh and pure at my most recent meal here all four members of our party ordered the chicken and all four cleaned the plate so completely you would have thought it had never seen foodwhile a taste of this signature dish should not be missed several other appetizers and small snacks deserve almost equal praise at the top of this list is the hot foie gras served next to pork belly in a hot ham broth true to the rest of betonys style this piece of foie gras seems so simply executed at first yet the purity of flavors does not belie a handsomely silky rich and perfectly textured bite the radicchio tardivo with beets and robiola bosina is another creamy yet light addition to the meal with entrees ranging from and appetizers from betony is fitting for a superbly special meal that doesnt have to break the bank like a tasting menu easily couldservice is incredibly knowledgeable and calmly prepared to please to perfection for our bread course the pastry chef even prepared a phenomenal piece of glutenfree bread for our resident allergyridden guest and our server was able to tell us the preparation of every dish to astonishing depth its the kind of subtle hospitality that makes a delicious meal even that much more rewardingalthough it stretches across levels with the main dining spaces on the first and upper levels and a private room downstairs the space still manages to feel like an intimate private dining experience in ones own parlour the twotops and fourtops are larger than normal and spaced a good deal apart giving each diner room to both spread out and cozy up in the plush purple velvet banquettes and admire the ornate molded ceiling panels its a space that feels both personal and fantastically regal all at once

proud to be a chineseamerican before the rise in popularity of iconic modern day nyc restaurants like union square cafe daniel bouley and peter luger chinatown ny defined east coast chinese cuisine now if we discount san francisco in the nation of california the hour restaurants on mott street began to inspire the theme for the tribeca film festival documentary the search for general tso asian cuisines have evolved as fast as social media in the usa arguably becoming more american and longlasting than mcdonalds certainly the meteoric rise of asian cuisines i would argue has defined the yelp phenomenon anyway as i have always said it is all about the food with all due respect to my asian friends who prefer the many different asian cuisines my culinary tastes were defined by my parents of toisan descent while i love the spicy influence of thai szechuan hunan dishes etc my favorites have always been the old school cantonese dishes hop kee really defines the chinatown cantonese experience it may not be as well known as shun lee or even the more chineseamerican wo hop however on chinese new year it does not get any better than finding the back room in hop kees basement restaurant now on chinese new year hop kees back room is always hopping with the chants of gong hay fat choy it is not the pictures of anthony bourdain and all the famous guests the waitors who look like your chinese grandfather the one button cash register or the metal containers that create the experience however on chinese new year the year of the goatsheep hop kee has a wonderful special menu of their famous pork chop clams with black bean sauce long life noodles and many others however my alltime favorite dish is hop kees crab cantonesea large plate of perfectly cracked blue crab with sizzling cantonese sauce made with black bean egg ground pork ginger scallion the eggs and shell on a piping hot plate with a medium bowl of perfectly steamed white rice constitute what i want to have one day for my last meal having the worlds best egg roll to start the meal perfectly cooked in a deep fryer is an allmadden meal at a higher level like a peter luger porterhouse this is something you cannot make at home i love the crab egg and the fact that i do not even need a mallet or crab cracker to open the perfectly prepared claws and backfin blue crabmeateat your heart out my fellow marylanders when i die take my body back to georgetown but give me a crab cantonese chinese new year meal at hop kee below mott street i was not born in asia but on this chinese new year i could not be more proud than to be chinese and born in the united states i dedicate this review to two of my grandparents thomas wong my paternal grandfather and lee ngon win chin my maternal grandmother who like many toisanese made it possbile for more recent immigrants to come to this country lastly thanks to hop kee for making chinese new year special i will argue with any of my asian friends that hop kees crab cantonese is an asian meal beyond compare old school chinese babygong hay fat choydr thomas a wonggeorgetown doublehoyaproud to be a chineseamerican

sake bar hagi is one of my dependable standbys ive been coming here for years lowkey dates catching up with friends and even solo dining this bar has always got me coveredreasonable prices service is always on point and if you go early or laaaate enough you wont have to deal with a waittheir menu covers the gamut of what youd expect at a japanese bar light bites galore the tofu agedashi is a good warm up and then you can move onto skewers who doesnt like yakitori and if you have a hankering for ramen late nights yes theyve got ramen theyll save you a walk to a specialty noodle shop most which will be closed by then and itll fill you uptheres a tv if youre into that and plenty of alcohol if youre into that and seating for a decent group so youll never be bored
easily one of the top beer shops in all of nyc huge variety of beer in every price range style origin you can think of warehouse style place you can mix and match packs buy as many or few bottles as you want of each beer bottles are priced individually so you can pick and choose they also have a small selection of taps its a bit out of the way so make a day trip out of it and hit some good restaurants and shops in the area staff were very helpful large selection of local and regional beers from all around the us lots of stuff i had never heard of and lots i was very familiar with great selection of ipas farmhouses saisons hefs lagers ales etc small selection of sours as well you pay at the window which isnt quite traditional but it works came here and spent about on a large selection of beer even got some advice from two guys who were shoppers and looking at some similar beers nice folks i will definitely be coming here again next time im in the area or have a hankering for some unusual beers
as a guy id rate new clothing shopping slightly above going in for a dental cleaning which im overdue for so after a large shopping spree at macys on i found myself with two pairs of new jeans unfortunately for me god did not make me a length that agrees with most traditional jean sizes leaving me in the precarious position of needing to get them hemmed dating back to my days living in north jersey it was relatively cheap and easy to find a place to get this done every town had a few laundromats or tailorshey i know its new york city there are plenty of places to get your jeans hemmed however the prices shocked me during my initial local search in my neighborhood greenwich village they wanted to charge me dollars per pair the horrori decided to take matters into my own hands and went on yelp and found this little east village gem i called in advance and found out with their coupon on here and by checking in you can get original stitched jeans hemmed for dollars no its not a typo these are oldschool new york city prices i arrived there on a chilly wednesday after walking more than a mile the lengths we go to save dollars in manhattan and chuckled as i saw they posted a list of peoples faces via video surveillance who had shop lifted as a way to shame them bad very bad people who did that i digress after entering the large store with rows of clothes and large lights reminiscent of a fashion runway i was greeted by air a very friendly receptionist who explained to me the different types of hemming available didnt know there was more than one before and also suggested to me using the yelp coupon code on my phone app which was very nice of her i had her put pins on the bottom of the jeans as they were bootcut and needed to be cut just enough to not scrape the ground she told me they would be ready in days and even suggested me a coffee spot down the street i reviewed it too yay after days she called and told me they were ready so i strolled back before heading to a yelp event also reviewed it im on a roll here and i went back in and tried the newly hemmed jeans on they were cut to exactly where id have wanted not so long that they were touching the bottom of my shoes but not so short that youd see my socks if i sat down in other words they were hemmed to hit that magical sweet spot that so few hemmed jeans ever reach and the original stitching was still in place successful plastic surgery of my jeans was completed i thanked air switched my frumpy pants for one of the newly hemmed jeans and headed out feeling great suffice to say i would recommend other yelpers come here for any of their hemming or tailoring needs as this store is simply cut from a different cloth

seriously you must try this place it was spectacular aside from having a cozy atmosphere the food and service were phenomenal my friend and i opted to order and split the bibimbap with spicy chicken and the le grand bulgolgi i probably liked the le grand bulgogi a bit more but the bibimbap was tasty as well the bulgogi is chefs cut prime beef ribeye marinated in korean barbecue sauce grilled on open fire served with kimchi and brussels sprouts the barbecue sauce has a nice mesquite flavor the steak should be eaten completely together with the kimchi and brussels sprouts for an absolute perfect bite the bulgogi which we ordered medium rare was tender melt in your mouth perfection the bibimbap with spicy chicken was served with a bowl of rice with bean sprouts zucchini shiitake mushroom julienned carrots seaweed chips gochujang a red chili sauce and a fried egg you mix everything together yourself for a really nice portion of bibimbap it was a nice blend of flavors for dessert we opted for the green tea pudding if you like the flavor of green tea ice cream youll definitely enjoy this its served in a shooter and topped with house made whipped cream and a cookie crumble the pudding is not too heavy or sweet so i left feeling like i could still fit in my clothes just a note although our dishes came out at the same time at the tables to the left and right of us their food was served at different times it would be nice if the restaurant could address this issue either way dont let that deter you from coming here

city bakery brings its popular offshoot birdbath to midtown east here you have a bakery that is dedicated to fresh organic ingredients for its salads sandwiches and soups with that comes a relatively steeper price point for most breakfast and lunch seekers who are not picky it will annoy some who notice that prices are not listed anywhere an average meal can set you back for others who appreciate the concept of an ecofriendly eatery birdbath has everything going for it the salads and soups taste very fresh and flavorful leaving you not feeling overdosed in oil or sodium by the end of consumption if you are allowed one bad eat for comfort then their macncheese will surely hit that spot the vegan chocolate chip cookies are excellent without being oversugared and the amazing city bakery hot chocolate with giant marshmallows can be found here as well the enormous bakers muffin alone with its crusted top sprinkled with powdered sugar and soft interior loaded with raisins and walnuts makes it worth giving birdbath a visit

flat rate is the absolute best they truly made our moving experience seamless after a last minute decision to move we called a few places for quotes although flat rate was a little higher of the quotes i was assured that we wouldnt be paying more than quotedman were they right the movers came early asked the right questions and let us go grab breakfast while the loaded the truck when we came back they were almost done and i couldnt believe how fast they moved out the boxes and small items that i didnt count for in my quote were included at no additional costmoving in was a piece of cake too flights of stairs is not easy but i didnt hear them complain once they didnt break or damage anything and put my furniture exactly where i askedfor any future moves ill be using flat rate thanks guys
collaborative food markets are having a moment in this past year from gotham west market to hudson eats food hall or food court style spaces are housing some great talent all under one roof the most recent to join this trend is gansevoort market in the meatpacking districtonce occupied by a club this open space now has an array of food offering with a seating section underneath an incredible skylight and wrapped up in branches and bits of nature below are a list of all the vendors in no particular order dojo sushi is serving authentic japanese cuisine and sushitacombi serves mexican street food and tacoschampion coffee serves coffeeheermance farm purveyors has organic produce from the hudson valleyluzzos has coal oven pizzathe bruffin cafe serves a muffinbriochelike pastry filled with quality ingredientspig guy nyc serves bbqyiaourti has a greek yogurt bar with sheeps milk yogurtcrêpe sucre is a french crêpe bareds lobster bar serves new england seafoodgansevoort bakery is a greek bakerycappones is an authentic italian specialties and sandwich shopour true roots makes beverages and snacks from tiger nutsdanas bakery makes french macaronslov organic has organic teasfeel food has organic juice and highly nutritious fooddonostia serves spanish tapasflower girl has whimsical flower arrangements

sweating so with that you could fairly assume that i wouldve walked into the studio turned right around to walk out but i didnt i kept going after my very day i finished their day challenge which is thirty classes in thirty days dedication p whoohoostudio lobbyyou can either take the stairs or take the elevator to the floor when you get upstairs you remove your shoes place them in one of the cubbies provided you then check in at the counter there you can rentbuy items eg coconut water smart water yoga clothing mats towels etclocker roomthe womens locker room is kept pretty clean there are a lot of lockers definitely enough for the of students that would be attending the class dont forget to bring your own lock even a small luggage one would do the locker room is very narrow so canwill get crowded when classes are cominggoing they provide some toiletries for everyone eg soap shampooconditioner qtips etc they even supply blow dryers brushes etc there are showers they are limited to studio is on the floor you can take the elevator or the stairs be careful when taking the stairs as there can be a good amount of sweat so use those handrails there is also a little outside area where students can hang out beforeafter a class but usually after everyone falls in line outside the studio to wait to be let in an employee usually comes to turn the room in between classes before the next class is to begin that is when the next class can start entering to claim their spot the studio gets supercrazyridiculously hot but thats the point the room is carpet as bikram yoga is supposed to be so not sure why some of the other reviewers were complaining about it but i do see the concern wthe sweat this is very true you can definitely seefeel the sweat in the carpet but it really isnt that bad imo or maybe its just me i will say that they do need to vacuum a bit more as there can be a good amount of debris on the carpet the classes fit people you can sign up through their appwebsite or at the studiobikram yogathe class itself is rough definitely something you need to keep working on though you do the same postures in each class you realize you can always get better go into each posture more in my case im still trying to learn how to do all of them correctly or just get into them in general ive met people who have said theyve been doing yoga for over years they still need to take breaks in class i applaud them hope to keep it up myself also the instructors always remind you to only look at yourself so there is no competition here you are only there to better yourselfinstructorshere are the list of instructors ive taken in the last consecutive days the of times i had them the order i had them patrick okeefe kleinbeger ritz marco gartner lynch velasquez yefet strandquist maldonado seamon klose saunders faurholt all have their own ways of teaching but the foundation is all the same some instructors like the class more humid some wmore heat some wa good balance of both also some instructors teach more military style others are a bit more laid back but something that goes across the board wall of them is that they are all incredibly supportive like seriously so supportive of you your needs your practice everything in between they are such positive beings as i continue to practice i am trying to get it to rub off on me as you continue to go youll begin to have your favorite instructors i know i have mine i just dont feel it is fair to post mine as everyone is different you should come try a few classes out for yourself to see what fitsafter finishing the challenge not only has my physical health improved but so has my mental health i am much more patient kind encouraging to the people around me also ive learned how to brush off a lot of the things that would normally get to me there wereare some days where my cardiacasthma issues are getting the best of me but i still attend class when people doubt my decision i explain to them how i would not go if the instructors werent as encouragingsupportive as they are or if it were a competition with the other students i go at my own pace and the instructors respectsupportencourage that when in the room i feel detached from my life any other stresses i am there to just focus on myself for that alone feels refreshing

beads of sweat are rolling down your cheek thoughts of panic are racing through your mind you hastily run through the items from a mental checklist youve swiftly strung together first remember to add the garnish second wipe off the excess drops of sauce that eagerly dripped from your ladle and splashed onto the barren white plate that is your canvas time is quickly running out and before you know it youre down to the last few seconds of the clock boom time is upclearly if you can crank out amazing dishes under intense pressure you can only begin to imagine the quality plates top chef season winner harold dieterle can assemble under ample time shortly after his win he opened perilla located in the west side despite its rampant growth in popularity perilla has remained modest the decor strays from opulence and is instead enhanced with tasteful simplicity the lighting is resplendent and brilliantly golden altogether perilla presents a very charismatic and handsome atmosphere perilla has a menu full of fine fresh american fare the ingredients are heavily dependent on what is locally available and thus the menu seasonally changes the menu clearly reflects dieterles love affair with asian ingredients the menu is embellished with vibrant asian notes basil kimchi black sesame and bok choy a separate menu was created for new york restaurant week steamed mussels are the perfect appetite primer they are steamed and tossed in rings of sautéed yellow onions the mussels are topped with a coarse mixture of garlic bread crumbs for a satisfying texture and bathed in a creamy stock minuscule pieces of tasso ham are also sprinkled onto the dish for a smoky flavor this was swiftly followed by the roasted all natural chicken this features a thick slab of chicken breast served over a bed of pearl barley the skin was perfectly salted and crispy the breast was oozing with au jus this entree playfully incorporates the flavors of roasted peaches coriander cumin and fresh chilies all desserts are designed by laura jackson the panna cotta unites an eclectic combination of flavors lime jalapeños and gooey melted caramel it is adorned with cereallike puffs of amaranth for a delightful crunch my favorite element of the dessert was the sweet sorbet that was transformed from watermelon juice perillas wine list is extensive i ordered a glass of sherry valdespino contrabandista amontillado it has a deep nutty flavor with strong accents of plum i definitely recommend this for people who enjoy fruity concentrated and medium dry winesome pro tips cards are accepted restrooms are a little small but wellkept perilla features booths that are appropriate for larger parties there is a bar large enough to seat comfortably in the first half of the restaurant the staff was extremely welcoming and the service was spotless throughout the night

ten years and only ordinary ie sadlooking glasses for those times right before bed and such when those ordinary glasses broke recently i knew that it was time to get a pair i could actually wear are free to try on as many pairs as theyd like i the staff when i was first browsing they completely left me alone but when i grew a bit overwhelmed with the selection i guess my body language made it obvious one staff member swiftly came over and eased my anxiety and suggested frames that went well with my face even though i took forever in making a decision and asked at least three different staff members to pick from my top two everyone made the experience seamless and enjoyable how easy it was to purchase frames all prescription frames are total with an option to get highindex lenses for higher prescriptions at only more they accept eyeglass prescriptions that are up to a year old but they can also call your eye doctor or schedule you for an eye exam there for their home tryon system i went to the store because i live relatively close by and because i wanted to try on as many frames in as many colors as possible but most people opt to do the home tryon it gives people an parker team is very interested in all things literary the most obvious clue comes from the library setup of all of their manhattan stores and the less obvious clue comes from their blog they update their blog with infographics of things to read and see and theyre oftentimes very funny i also learned that the stores name is derived from two kerouac characters warby pepper and zagg parker zagg pepper would also have been a cool store name their buy a pair give a pair philosophy they make a monthly donation based on the number of glasses sold and those funds go to training glasses and eye exams in developing countries their monocle warbyparkercommonoclelikelihood of another visitwhen these glasses break
tldrthis place tops everything i have reviewed starstldr you dont read anything in my review go to benton on a friday early like before pm and get their friday special chirashi then come back and read this review you will know why i freaking rave about this placeif i could give stars benton gets it no chez panisse and ippudo are nowhere close to getting starswhat makes benton so magical is that they make the most incredible benton boxes that i have ever tasted no experienced in the united states i spent some time studying abroad in tokyo when i was in college and i used to drop by this bento shop after my language school classes were over at around pm they were still selling the leftover bento boxes from lunch at a discount and if im lucky i could score a bento for just yen or so and have it as a yummy dinner benton is the reincarnation of that neighborhood bento shop in new york citybentons bento boxes are really tasty i repeat really tasty you are probably used to shelling out for the soba totto or the sakagura lunch specials to be honest i stopped going to soba totto or sakagura for lunch altogether after i discovered benton their lunch specials are just as good for half the price its so amazing i have no idea how they do itevery single one of bentons bento boxes is a carefully curated symphony of flavors its crazy how many contrasting tastes they can pack into one bento box were talking a main course rice plus side dishes the side dishes are truly the stars of the bento for example you might see a clump of spinach next to your katsu for lunch but rest assured that spinach will certainly not be the plain boiled spinach you eat at home one day it will be lightly tossed with vinegar the next you might find a small dallop of sesame dressing at the bottom some of the small dishes are simply delightful they often make these cute little vegetable skewers were talking inches long and then they deep fry the whole thing and pack it into a bento for your dining pleasure who does that what do you eat for lunch a box of randomly chopped vegetables that cost you at chopt a greasy hamburger smashed together over a smoky grill with onions and tomatoes carelessly thrown on topi really admire the dedication and the time that is simply so evident in bentons bento boxes yes they may make food to go but i would honestly pay double the price for sit down portions of their bentos in a restaurant woorijip in ktown used to a goto place for packed boxed meals but i was just at woorijip last night and it almost makes me angry that woorijip is such a large establishment and open at all hours while benton is a small corner storefront in midtown thats functionally only open for lunch im angry that woorijips food is so inferior compared to benton and im angry that benton does not get more recognitionanyways just go and prepare for your mind to be blown and it will be if you know what good japanese food taste like if you gobenton has amazing usually some form of sushi donburi lunch specials on the weekdays if you want to partake please go early they are usually almost out by pm and certainly out any time after that the bento boxes luckily are not part of the special but they usually run out by pm toonot only does benton have amazing sushibentos their cold noodlerice bowls offerings are great too i had the opportunity to try their bibimnoodle like a bibimbap but with noodles get it p and their hiyashi chuka cold noodles with sesame sauce and both are fantastic i also like their sauce katsu rice bowlthey also make hot food soba udon and ramen ive actually never seen anybody order it because it probably takes some time but you could try it if you wantfree miso soup with purchase of bento make sure you ask for it sometimes the cashier doesnt give it to you unless you ask for itthey have a rewards program but its unfortunately one of the most lowyield reward programs to the order of something like buy bentos get free but still better than nothingtheyre open on saturday but the selection is very small and looks almost like recycled friday food even though im sure it isnt i would recommend to pass on saturdaythey also have bread and onigiri if you dont want a bowl or a boxed lunch every meal is around seriouslythis is so much text i cant handle it just go sparknotes now go on thursfri lunch and get their chirashis friday is better try any of their bento boxes repeat rinse fall in love try all of themi had two weeks when i was just studying for my board exams i had benton every single day for lunch i was so if by chance you started a foolish quest to try each of the top beers on beer advocate within a calendar year the jeffrey would be a frequent source of aid you might encounter bottles from the bruery maine beer co and even on rarer occasion the rarest belgians and assuming youre sane enough not to attempt an endeavor so frustrating the bar remains more than worth the trip the rotating drafts run the gamut from the accessible at the moment captain lawrences liquid gold to the arcane at the moment anderson valleys the kimmie the yink and the holy gose and change frequently enough to warrant stopping by more often than your wallet will appreciate however what propels the jeffrey to perfection are the generous extensive and thoughtfully curated growler program not to mention the loyalty program therein buy growlers of beer the tenth is free after the get a personalized growler and off for life and the fantastic lunch and happy hour specials lunch is a mere for a happy hour brew and a sandwich or salad and none of the food options are afterthoughts the sandwiches are preposterously good not in comparison to typical bar fare but in comparison to standalone sandwich shops happy hour is impressive in both the breadth of hours and the depth of beer selections available people may lament the fact that the jeffrey is all the way up on and whiners but truthfully the area was in need of a place so objectively great being far from the useless hipster masses is just a bonus

toho shoji is a japanese beadcrafts store so glad i found it i used to buy toho beads in japan when i was into making things when i was younger i got back into beading recently and found this store through yelp so glad i went everything is high quality although more expensive than other bead stores in the area but you can see the difference and the people that work there are all japanese and very helpful this one woman helped me find what i was looking for and i was in there looking at everything for a while everything in the store is very organized and clean unlike the nearby chinese stores that are all dusty my hands felt very dirty after going there and the lighting in the store is as it should be overall i would definitely come back here to buy beads once i finish my current projectsupdate ive been into toho and other bead stores in the surrounding area and have found that toho sells the cheapest chains with the highest quality for example i bought a chain for a long necklace that was whereas across the street at bead center they sold a similar chain with cheaper quality for i also bought a chain with an infinity link online it didnt seem to feel like real metal felt light and almost plastic like when compared for a couple of cents cheaper than the infinity link chain i bought at toho it was shinier had a good weight and looked more expensive for about toho will definitely be my goto spot for buying all sorts of chains they have a wider variety are all superior in quality and have a really good price

escape the room brought my favorite genre of pointandclick games to life motas anyone google it and not only did it not disappoint it went above and beyond my expectations bottom line i cant wait to come backmy sister and i chose the home so we were locked up in a room with other strangers with the same goal find the key to get out of the room here are some tips teamwork is required otherwise precious time will be lost pay attention to the clues from the clue master there are hints between the lines think outside of the box touch and play with everything in the room but dont break anything come with a buddy who thinks like you you are after all working with mostly strangersmy competitive spirit definitely emerged among the adrenaline rush this is a game of patience and creative intellect so dont try to hulk smash everythingget impatientgive up easily at the end the clue master will walk through every puzzle with your team i really appreciated the details and thought the creators placed in this gamejust keep in mind to have fun and try to escape if you can

hot damn i always knew the frick was considered a sortofhidden gem but i didnt expect to like it as much as i did its a small museumif you take your time at each painting you can still walk it all in hours its big enough to wow youi kept seeing paintings i recognized and thinking i didnt know we had this in nyc toobut small enough not to overwhelm you its collection of art spans centuries and is eclectic i dont think its heavily frequented by tourists and it doesnt allow children so its pretty peaceful i was there on a weekday though so that mayve contributed to its relative emptinessscattered thoughts you wont feel guilty for not reading all the details on the placards by the works because there are no placards most of the works have no notes other than the name and the artist if you do want more detail the audio guides are free i didnt listen to them but ive heard from others theyre detailed and very good an introductory movie plays every half hourits only minutes long and is worthwhile it gives you a brief overview of herny clay frick and how the museum came about if youre pressed for time the video plays on the website as well highlights include all of the turners you can recognize them from across a room theyre so distinctivebright colors huge landscapes impressing nature upon you impressionistic swathes before impressionism was a thing mixed in with extraordinarily fine architectural details the fragonard room these paintings all ought to be kitschy with their unreal lushness and macaron colors but they overwhelm you with their skill and exuberance also they are amusingly pervertedjust look at the one with the bosomy blond dreamily eyeing the sky while her hands down between her notverysubtly spread legs shes fully clothed in an elaborate dress but it doesnt change whats happening you look at this painting and imagine fragonard had a very good time in his studio rembrandts the polish rider may not be a rembrandt its status is contested

best dukbokki ive experienced in ktown its loaded with seafood mozzarella and rice cake the ingredients were all in balance i have no complaints regarding the food some negatives however the service this is only the second location for this popular brooklynbased bake shop that opened a few days ago on street their advertisement mentions that theyre the former staff of the legendary baker cakeman raven when i stopped by over the weekend it was only their second day doing business and they still had a few noticeable touches to make both the inside and outside of the shop nevertheless they seemed to still be pretty well stocked and ready to introduce harlem to their cakes they were even giving out samples right outside i should mention that its a pretty small shop with no inside seating and just a few seats outside for those who prefer to sit and eat rather than take their cake on the road and as far as i can tell they basically just sell cakes cupcakes and ice cream prices are low with slices of cake going for six dollars and three dollars for cupcakes not bad at allive already heard a lot of talk about their brooklyn shop so im looking forward to adding this place to my list of regular neighborhood dropin spots so far ive only had a slice of their signature red velvet cake but i enjoyed it very much and felt that it well exceeded my expectations the cake and frosting were both surprisingly very light and not too sweetperfectly balanced and the slices are really big too id have to say that for me it was probably the best red velvet cake that id tasted anywhere which means that ill be dropping in again soon

when i was doing my morning walk to the subway a few weeks back it wasnt the unassuming red awning that caught my eye or the fact that yet another restaurant slide in this case had bit the dust it was the name of the eatery soon to be replacing it old tbilisi i rubbed my minds eyes in disbelief whaaaaa a georgian restaurant on bleecker street for many years and until the last couple youd have to go to kings highway avenue u or brighton beach in brooklyn to get some decent georgian food not counting all the pansoviet places that infuse their menus with dishes from the caucuses but signs dont lie not with the rents you pay to open up a business in this part of town ever since that day i kept watch on the windows watching old tbilisi gestate from occupancy permit to posted menu to this past week open for businessas soon as i saw the open doors and the waitstaffwell waiting for diners in the doldrums of the very early evening i lined up the so and my brother for an exploratory trip as soon as we entered we were told that they didnt have their booze license yet in case that would influence our decision to partake we went in with this very expectation but i appreciated the full disclosure im sure it saves restaurants aggravation with folks complaining after they sit down it should be noted that there is no byob option due to recent changes in the law which i have seen with other places that opened in the past year but they will have full booze soon they already had a couple of diners there and luckily there was still room in the nice garden in the back we walked past the bar area and long dining room some changes have been made since slide times there was a large stone waterfall fountain that actually looked fairly real these can look quite tacky sometimesthen our feast began my brother was there for one thing above all the khachapuri they have a couple of varieties but the one he wanted was khachapuri adjarian straightouttheoven georgian bread with an open lid in the center filled with delicious sulguni cheese topped with a poached egg whisk it around the waiter will show you to create the delicious mishmash that makes this georgian calzone one of the tastiest things on the menu of course we also noshed on other tasty appetizers starting with a basic tomatocucumberonion salad one of my all time favorites then a very good dish of marinated zucchini eggplant and peppers and finally some obligatory khinkali georgian dumplings we got the porkbeef variety but you can go for lamb too youll get three oversize dumplings the spiced meat encased by thick teepees of dough otg offers spices and flavors new and old its hard to think of a more authentic purveyor of georgian food in the boroughs at least one that ive come across there is much more menu to explore in old tbilisi and i will be back as long as they stick around fyi they should have their full bar up and running in a couple of months but if you care more about food than booze now is the time to check it out

at first i couldnt understand why kung fu tea would want to open a new store location right next to tea kettle and across the street from coco all bubble tea spots but it makes sense now im no bobabubble tea connoisseur but ive had my fair share of boba in this city i judge my boba based on how good the black milk tea is and the consistency of the boba it needs to have the right texture and chewiness without being mushy of all the boba tea spots in nyc i have to say kung fu tea is the best for nyc this new location is much bigger and definitely much more comfortable than the last location on street this location has indoor and outdoor seating and the best part is theyre open late i can finally satisfy that midnight craving because this location is open til just as the other locations you can control your sugar level and ice level to your likingsome of my favorites at kung fu tea are black milk tea green milk tea and the grapefruit green tea happy bobaing bobalife
this restaurant lives up to its name its the only wings restaurant that is truly international because of all the flavors that they offer i wish i had tried this place before the superbowl cuz the wings are so damn good this is not some random wings place in a sports bar the owner head chef is actually from the culinary institute of america and he makes all the sauces himselfin addition to the usual bbq sauce for your wings this place has exotic flavors such as spicy thai with basil or even vietnamese chili mango my favorite sauce was the mexy q imagine a delicious rich bbq sauce with a nice mexican chile kick to it i also enjoyed the garlic parmesan beurre banc which balanced out the mexy q because it was lighter you can opt for boneless wings or wings with the bone if you dont eat meat fret not they have vegan nuggets and turkey wignettes now lets talk about french fries you cant have wings without fries what makes the fries so special here is once again the different flavors i had both the normal fries and sweet potato fries yes i know all of you out there love sweet potato fries you must try the indian masala fries which were delicious where else are you gonna get masala fries we also had the pepper parmesan fries and southwestern make sure you get some dipping sauces they taste even better when dipped in ketchup or chipotle mayo a lot of people ordered take out from here but if you decide to sit in here and eat let me tell you the service was amazing we were able to speak to the head chef himself and he was able to recommend various sauces based on your personal preference he was also very friendly tooi cant wait to come back hereps they deliver too
bestpancakesevereverever ive been here a total of times in the last years and each time it never disappointed four of those visits were for pancake month and ive been fortunate enough to try some of their awesome flavors crunchy banana pistachio frangipane fresh coconut blueberry crumb streusel swedish apple and wild maine blueberry pancakesjust for those not in the know every february is pancake month at the bakery and every few days they serve a different flavor some are served day some days and some even days the bakery operates from opening on weekends and for the people who work during weekdays and want to try it out i recommend that you visit on a weekday for dinner a line usually forms at about ish but if you get here before youre almost guaranteed one of their seats when they open anyone not within the first wave of guests will usually have to wait about minutesas for the pancakes the serving size is big with pancakes and you can easily get full just off alone if you come here with a guest its best that one of you get the pancakes and the other get some other item so that you can share usually many guests will split the pancakes and also split an order of chicken waffles which is also incredible clinton st bakerys fried chicken is some of the best ive ever had the skin is super crunchy and the meat is very moist you can see the moisture on the meat the second you peel the skin right off of them the meal comes with pieces of chicken so be assured you will be stuffed from all that chicken plus a giant wafflenow back to the pancakes they are amazingly soft and fluffy with the topping usually covering about half of the top pancake included with every order is a small cup of warm maple butter if you thought the pancakes couldnt get any better the warm maple butter yes its as good as it sounds add another layer of richness to it when you slice off a piece of the pancakes and dip it in that warm goodness the pancake melts in your mouth its very addictive and that might be an understatementout of the pancakes ive tried so far ill have to say the crunchy banana might be my favorite its got a beautiful balance of sweet and sugary flavors with i absolutely love this place it is the epidemy of an english gastropubs without all that english plague vibrant food mulled wine the spotted pig is buzzing each night and you are bound to run into someone here with that in mind prepare in endure long waits and cramped seating definitely a place for some mean eats dont be confused with the menu here just know that this establishment belongs to that british subgenre called the gastropub a bar serving simple straightforward food however straightforward at the spotted pig means traditional english food transcending into an italian twist and for those of you who rather prefer to drink your dinner their bottle wine list and casks of beer will warm your soul also a great for brunch with the standard west village brunch prices but where else can you get gingerbread pancakes with a light vanilla cream candied almonds and a blizzard of powdered sugar or their deep fried poached eggs with chorizo stew did i mention their fried duck egg with ramps and anchovy dressing or their two poached eggs with roast pork hash damn im hungry again
piora was simply amazing and i had a wonderful time at this cozy restaurant in west village with my friends the restaurant newly opened under the command of simon kim the restaurateur and chris cipollone an amazing chef our experiences here could not have been better the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating providing an impeccable service the bartenders were amazing gotta try the sake nog and the food was fantastic no wonder why piora received so much publicity and was raved on magazines restaurant reviews and newspapers by so many the ambience was just perfect for a small party not too loud but intimate enough to really have a nice meal with friends with the beautiful lighting in the back of the restaurant i would highly recommend this place to couples as well for those who want a meal under a more casual setting please feel free to sit at the bar to enjoy your meal with a friend or even by yourself in any way this small restaurant can fit all our meal started with the complementary starter potato truffle soup which was tasty and followed by monkey bread sweet potato barbeque octopus and carrots my favorite was the carrot which was so unexpected the yogurt sauce blended well with the carrot and created perfect harmony it was certainly a new taste simple and elegant barbeque octopus was also amazing with an interesting twist i definitely sensed the korean element in this dish which was done in a contemporary approach the texture of the octopus was great sauce blended well and wonderfully presented sweet potato which is common in korea was perfect just the way it should be and it brought out the nostalgic feeling in me monkey bread with seaweed and rosemary lardo butter really kicked the door open for our demanding appetitesour main dishes were bucatini and rohan duck which were both out of this world bucatini with dungeness crab black garlic and chili added a light scent of spiciness to the dish while elevating the beautiful mixture of garlic and crab taste into a perfected crafted pasta rohan duck was quite possibly the best duck dish ive had in new york the jujube sauce and the tangy flavor created harmony with the richness of the duck it was just perfect we finished our dinner with a mango sorbet w cotton candy that was not only beautiful in presentation but also heavenly in taste mango pieces chopped with mango sorbet basil sauce creme and small meringue pieces was delightfully light and refreshing i am looking forward to come back here to try out other dishes as well my dining experience here was amazing and i cant wait to see the new menus that will be rolling out as the year goes also shinya yamao is also a key attribute to this wonderful place as his charismatic presence parallels his skills for the most wondrous drinks if you are not looking for a meal feel free to swing by and sit at the bar for drinks you will be pleasantly surprised thank you piora

diners beware you will leave here in a full on meat coma i dont know how i stumbled upon the cannibal i think i typed in dinner outside in flatiron and voila it came up in my search and i am so glad that it did i met up with one of my best friends for dinner here last night and we feasted i arrived first and sat at the bar they have a very extensive beer list and quite a few wines to choose from i let the bartender choose for me because i found him entertaining especially when he asked the other bartender if he peed when there was a wet spot on the floor once my friend arrived he ordered a beer and we sat outside the seating is semicommunal and since we were a party of two we shared a table with four guys no big deal we wanted to maximize our meat sampling so we decided to order a few smaller items instead of going with the apparently infamous half a pigs head which i will be trying next time when we come back with more people we started off with the ham plate which was basically three different kinds of piggy it was divine i love ham next came the bone marrow which kind of grossed me out because that is the part of the meat i avoid but i did dip some bread in the juices after my friend ate all of the marrow and then finally came our delicious jalapeno sausage ummm yum this was the best sausage i have had in my entire existence so good and i cant wait to try the other kinds we also threw in some broccoli rabe for good measure but its not really worth mentioning because it is not meat and who cares it was a vegetable and it tasted fine the vibe here is very laid back and not like most places you find in the area considering flatiron is basically full of pretentious people and wannabes trying to be cool i would come back here and would recommend to anyone who loves meati gained today but it was worth it
